original: @273a # // chos thams cad rang bzhin med par grub pa /
analyzed: @273a # // chos thams cad rang bzhin med par grub pa /
translated: Establishing the Absence of Intrinsic Nature in All Things

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: dngos po rnams la phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus par rgyas par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa mtha' dag gcod pa'i rgyu phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di
analyzed: dngos po rnams la phyin ci log gi blo can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus par rgyas par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa mtha' dag gcod pa'i rgyu phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di
translated: Since the afflictions of those who have erroneous ideas about things increase without exception, in order to teach them the unerring cause that completely severs all afflictions,🔽this treatise is composed.

original: brtsam mo // de la re zhig gang dag don dam par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa na /
analyzed: brtsam mo // de la re zhig gang dag don dam par dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin brjod pa na /
translated: In this regard, when the nature of things is described in the ultimate sense,

original: yang dag par de dag rang bzhin dang bcas par rjod par byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par de dag rang bzhin dang bcas par rjod par byed de /
translated: some describe them as having intrinsic nature.

original: de dag gi phyin ci log yin pa kho nar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi phyin ci log yin pa kho nar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are in error,

original: rigs pa dang lung dag gis dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dag gis dngos po rnams kyi skye ba dpyad par bya'o //
translated: the arising of things should be analyzed through reasoning and scripture.

original: gal te 'di snyam du myu gu la sogs pa'i skye ba sa bon la sogs pa'i rkyen can gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du myu gu la sogs pa'i skye ba sa bon la sogs pa'i rkyen can gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa kho na yin na /
translated: But if you think that the arising of a sprout, for example, which has conditions such as a seed, is renowned to everyone from cowherds on up,

original: de la dpyad par bya ci dgos /
analyzed: de la dpyad par bya ci dgos /
translated: why is it necessary to analyze it?

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid gtan la phab pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dpyad par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid gtan la phab pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dpyad par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable for those who are rational to analyze the nature of things,

original: @273b thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: @273b thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: because it would lead to an infinite regress and because it would lead to the absurdity that they would not be rational.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: tshad mas gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir dang / grags pa yang log par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir dang / grags pa yang log par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established by valid cognition and because it is possible that what is renowned is false.

original: de lta ma yin na rang la grags pa'i dor byas te 'jug pa rnams su yang gang la yang slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rang la grags pa'i dor byas te 'jug pa rnams su yang gang la yang slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then those who engage in debate would not be deceived by anything, having discarded what is renowned to everyone.

original: de la dper na 'jig pa yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du grags la /
analyzed: de la dper na 'jig pa yang rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du grags la /
translated: For example, destruction is renowned as having a cause.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi don nyid du grags su zin kyang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi don nyid du grags su zin kyang /
translated: Although form and so on are renowned as external objects,

original: dpyad pa byas na tshad mas gnod pa srid pa de bzhin du 'di la yang grags pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo yang srid pas dpyad par bya bar rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: dpyad pa byas na tshad mas gnod pa srid pa de bzhin du 'di la yang grags pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo yang srid pas dpyad par bya bar rung ba nyid do //
translated: when analyzed, it is possible that valid knowledge will contradict them. In the same way, it is possible that even the nature of false renown could be analyzed.

original: de la lung rigs pa dang bral ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams rangs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la lung rigs pa dang bral ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams rangs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that regard, those who are reasonable will not be satisfied with a scripture that is devoid of reasoning.

original: rigs pas brtan por byas pa'i lung yang don gzhan du drang bar mi nus pas de'i phyir re zhig rigs pas dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pas brtan por byas pa'i lung yang don gzhan du drang bar mi nus pas de'i phyir re zhig rigs pas dpyad par bya'o //
translated: And a scripture that is made firm by reasoning cannot be interpreted to have another meaning. Therefore, first it should be analyzed by reasoning.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag yang dag par rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba dang bral ba de dag ni yang dag par na rang bzhin med pa yin te //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag yang dag par rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba dang bral ba de dag ni yang dag par na rang bzhin med pa yin te //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is free from being produced from self, from another, from both, and from no cause is ultimately essenceless,

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, a sky flower.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi skye bos smras pa 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bas don gyis na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi skye bos smras pa 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bas don gyis na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Since the statements of ourselves and others are similar to that, in fact, it is a nonobservation of a pervader.

original: skye bas dngos po rang bzhin la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bas dngos po rang bzhin la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising pervades the nature of things.

original: 'di la dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang mi bsam ste /
analyzed: 'di la dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang mi bsam ste /
translated: Here, do not think that the thesis is undermined by perception,

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that ultimately there is no intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du don dam par yod par mngon sum du grags pa ni ma yin te /🔽'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don dam pa pa yin par 'dod pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid du don dam par yod par mngon sum du grags pa ni ma yin te / 'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don dam pa pa yin par 'dod pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo'am /
translated: It is not the case that things are perceived to exist ultimately as possessing intrinsic reality.🔽In this regard, first, if external objects are asserted to be ultimate, is the nature of the whole one with the nature of the accumulation of subtle atoms?

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin grang ni //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin grang ni //
translated: Or is it one with the nature of the accumulation of subtle atoms?

original: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of both of those is not reasonable as perception.

original: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag snang ba ma gtogs pa yan lag can snang ba nyams su myong ba yang med la /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa yan lag snang ba ma gtogs pa yan lag can snang ba nyams su myong ba yang med la /
translated: Apart from the appearance of the parts, such as the hand, etc., there is no experience of the appearance of the whole.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang rags pa dang rnam pa gcig tu snang ba can gyi shes pa'i yul du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang rags pa dang rnam pa gcig tu snang ba can gyi shes pa'i yul du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: And the subtle particles are not suitable as objects of a consciousness that appears as one with the gross.

original: de dang rnam pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rnam pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have the same aspect.

original: @274a * // shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba gang dag gnyis med pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid de kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi lta ba la yang de mngon sum du ma grub ste /
analyzed: @274a * // shes bya nang gi yin par smra ba gang dag gnyis med pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid de kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi lta ba la yang de mngon sum du ma grub ste /
translated: Those who maintain that the object of knowledge is internal and that it is only nondual consciousness that is reality, their view is also not established by direct perception,

original: dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i shes pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at all times the consciousness that appears as the apprehended and apprehender is experienced.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad de kho na mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad de kho na mthong ba kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then everyone would see reality alone.

original: des na thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the effort of those who seek liberation to generate the ārya path would be pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the Bhagavān has said:

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma min //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: lce dang lus dang sems kyang tshad ma min ;
analyzed: lce dang lus dang sems kyang tshad ma min ;
translated: The tongue, body, and mind are not valid cognitions.

original: / gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
analyzed: / gal te dbang po 'di dag tshad yin na //
translated: If these faculties were valid cognitions,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis su la ci zhig bya //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis su la ci zhig bya //
translated: what would the noble path do for anyone?

original: 'di ltar dbang po 'di dag tshad min te //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po 'di dag tshad min te //
translated: Thus these faculties are not valid cognitions,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi bems po lung ma bstan //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi bems po lung ma bstan //
translated: being inert by nature and neutral.

original: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i lam 'dod gang //
analyzed: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa'i lam 'dod gang //
translated: Therefore, those who desire the path to nirvāṇa

original: des ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bya ba byos //🔽zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: des ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bya ba byos // zhes gsungs so ;
translated: should perform the function of the noble path.

original: / gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: / gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If all things are essenceless,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe de dag yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par sngon po dang / phya le ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe de dag yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par sngon po dang / phya le ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: then how is it that at that time they appear to be of the nature of blue, yellow, long, short, and so on, which are ascertained to be objects, times, and so on?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzugs bzhin du brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzugs bzhin du brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear to be false, like the forms that appear to mistaken consciousnesses.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i rnam pa rnams don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i rnam pa rnams don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin yang /
translated: Just as the aspects that appear to mistaken consciousnesses do not ultimately have intrinsic reality,

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par snang ba ltar gzhan dag kyang de dang 'dra bas mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par snang ba ltar gzhan dag kyang de dang 'dra bas mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: other things are similar to that, so there is no contradiction.

original: gang de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don de lta bu de yang med la /
analyzed: gang de ltar snang bar 'gyur ba zla ba gnyis la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don de lta bu de yang med la /
translated: That external object, such as a second moon, that appears in that way does not exist.

original: yul dang dus gzhan na yod pa'i don yang yul dang dus la sogs pa snang ba dang 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid med na /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan na yod pa'i don yang yul dang dus la sogs pa snang ba dang 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid med na /
translated: If an object that exists in another place and time does not have an essence that is related to the appearance of a place and time,

original: gang gis na 'di de'i ngo bor snang ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di de'i ngo bor snang ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: by what is it that it appears as its essence?

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ba rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ba rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for one thing to appear as the essence of another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta na don dam pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na don dam pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, all objects would be the objects of all consciousnesses.

original: gang gis na snang bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gzhan yang de la med de /
analyzed: gang gis na snang bar 'gyur ba'i ngo bo gzhan yang de la med de /
translated: And the nature of the other, which would appear, does not exist in it.

original: du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that there would be many consciousnesses.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de shes pa'i ngo bor bden pa nyid du @274b rigs pa ma yin te /🔽shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin sna tshogs ma yin ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa de shes pa'i ngo bor bden pa nyid du @274b rigs pa ma yin te / shes pa gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin sna tshogs ma yin ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not reasonable that the nature of the consciousness of two moons and so on is real.🔽Because it would follow that, like the nature of the consciousness itself, it would not be a variety, since it is not a different nature from a single consciousness.

original: de dang shes pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin sna tshogs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang shes pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin sna tshogs nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or because it is not different from the consciousness, it would follow that, like the nature of the consciousness itself, it would be a variety.

original: yul la bkram pa ltar 'dug par yongs su 'dzin par snang ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs nyid yin par gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la bkram pa ltar 'dug par yongs su 'dzin par snang ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs nyid yin par gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir shes pa du ma skye bar rtogs pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not good reasoning that many consciousnesses are produced because of the appearance of the variety of aspects that apprehend the object as if it were spread out before it.

original: shes pa rnams ni lus med pa nyid kyi phyir yul la bkram pa ltar 'dug par yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni lus med pa nyid kyi phyir yul la bkram pa ltar 'dug par yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cognitions, being incorporeal, do not have the nature of being extended in space.

original: de lta bas na don dam par na de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par na de dag shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, it is not possible for them to be of the nature of cognition.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par yang snang ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag yul dang dus la sogs pa nges par yang snang ste /
translated: Nevertheless, they appear to be restricted to a particular place and time.

original: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang snang ba mi 'gal ba nyid pas dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyi gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad don dam pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin yang snang ba mi 'gal ba nyid pas dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyi gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, although all things are devoid of ultimate nature, it is not contradictory for them to appear. Thus, direct perception does not contradict our thesis.

original: gal te 'di snyam du mngon sum gyis gnod pa med du zin kyang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid ni gsal rab tu dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du mngon sum gyis gnod pa med du zin kyang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid ni gsal rab tu dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: Even if direct perception does not contradict it, it is clear that there is a contradiction with your own words.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag la nges pa skyed par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag la nges pa skyed par 'dod de /
translated: This is because you wish to generate certainty in others.

original: gtan tshigs smra bas gtan tshigs kyis nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir nges pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs smra bas gtan tshigs kyis nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir nges pa ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the logician accepts that certainty is produced by the logical reason, he would accept that certainty has an intrinsic reality.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the application of the logical reason would be meaningless.

original: khas blangs pa 'dis na rang bzhin med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la gnod pas nga'i ma ni mo gsham yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar gsal rab nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa 'dis na rang bzhin med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la gnod pas nga'i ma ni mo gsham yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar gsal rab nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that by this acceptance the thesis of intrinsic realitylessness is undermined, and that thus the contradiction of your own words is clear, just as in the case of “my mother is a barren woman,”

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor mod kyi /
analyzed: nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor mod kyi /
translated: We do apply the logical reason in order to generate certainty,

original: des nges pa don dam par skye bar khas blangs bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nges pa don dam par skye bar khas blangs bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but that does not mean that we accept that certainty is produced ultimately.

original: 'on kyang skye ba tsam khas blangs bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba tsam khas blangs bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: We accept only the mere production,

original: skye ba'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the specific production.

original: don dam pa'i skye ba bkag pas ni 'dir don dam pa par rang bzhin med par sgrub par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i skye ba bkag pas ni 'dir don dam pa par rang bzhin med par sgrub par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although the ultimate refutation of arising is established here as the ultimate absence of intrinsic reality,

original: skye ba tsam bkag pas ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis nges pa don dam par skye ba med kyis kyang gdong las gzugs brnyan bzhin @275a * //
analyzed: skye ba tsam bkag pas ni ma yin no // de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis nges pa don dam par skye ba med kyis kyang gdong las gzugs brnyan bzhin @275a * //
translated: it is not the mere refutation of arising.

original: du kun rdzob pa'i skye ba mi 'gal ba nyid pas dam bcas pa la yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: du kun rdzob pa'i skye ba mi 'gal ba nyid pas dam bcas pa la yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, although the reason refutes ultimate arising, it does not contradict the thesis, because, like a reflection, the contradiction of conventional arising is not contradictory.

original: nges pa kun rdzob pa de yang don dam pa rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs su tshad ma nyid du 'dod pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nges pa kun rdzob pa de yang don dam pa rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs su tshad ma nyid du 'dod pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Also, that conventional ascertainment is accepted as a valid cognition that is the reason for realizing the ultimate, so there is no fault.

original: 'dis ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i lung dang 'gal ba'i lan yang btab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i lung dang 'gal ba'i lan yang btab pa yin te /
translated: This also replies to the objection that it contradicts scripture, which teaches the connection between karma and its result, dependent origination, and so on,

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it accepts the conventional connection between karma and its result and so on.

original: kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the same for the ultimate, because it is not tenable to investigate it.

original: de brtag mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brtag mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were tenable to investigate it, then it would be conventional, not ultimate.

original: de lta ma yin na de don dam pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de don dam pa'i ngo bo kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were not so, then it would be the ultimate nature alone,

original: kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not conventional.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i rtags dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin du 'brel pa gang du yang ma grub pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i rtags dang / don dam pa'i rang bzhin du 'brel pa gang du yang ma grub pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no relation whatsoever between the ultimate and the signs of defilement and purification, etc., it is impossible for the ultimate to be invalidated by inference.

original: des phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu tsam zhig tu sgrub na ni grub pa sgrub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: des phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu tsam zhig tu sgrub na ni grub pa sgrub pa nyid yin te /
translated: If one proves that defilement, etc. are merely causes, then that is the establishment of what is already established,

original: de kun rdzob pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun rdzob pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that they are the causes of the conventional.

original: ming la ni brtsad pa med de /
analyzed: ming la ni brtsad pa med de /
translated: There is no dispute about names.

original: brdzun pa yang grags par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas kyang gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa yang grags par bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas kyang gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a falsehood, and because it is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: In the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra,🔽it is said, “The bodhisattva should not make the assertion that all things are essenceless.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes dam bcas par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de yang gcig kho nar rang bzhin med par dam 'cha' ba dgag pa yin par lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes dam bcas par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de yang gcig kho nar rang bzhin med par dam 'cha' ba dgag pa yin par lta ste /
translated: This also should be seen as a refutation of the assertion that the only essencelessness is of one thing from another,

original: kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin khas len pa'i phyir gcig kho na dgag pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin khas len pa'i phyir gcig kho na dgag pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it accepts the essencelessness of the conventional. It is not logical to refute only one of two things.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang gsal rab la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum la sogs pas gnod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang gsal rab la /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be contradicted by direct perception and so on.

original: de lta bu rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de lta bu rang bzhin med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: And it is quite clear that there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes that things are essenceless.

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis kyang 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis kyang 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere assertion of a thesis does not establish the desired conclusion.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would be established in every way.

original: de lta bas na don dam pa'i rang bzhin dgag par bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam pa'i rang bzhin dgag par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the ultimate should be refuted,

original: spyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in general.

original: de bas kyang de nyid las /
analyzed: de bas kyang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, the same text says:

original: @275b blo gros chen po snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: @275b blo gros chen po snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med do zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'i /
translated: “Mahāmati, because of the characteristic of appearance and nonappearance, the bodhisattva should not make the assertion, ‘All things are essenceless.’

original: blo gros chen po 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs te /🔽de la mdo'i don ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan par bya'o zhes gsungs te / de la mdo'i don ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Mahāmati, however, the bodhisattva should teach, ‘All phenomena are like illusions and dreams.’🔽”

original: mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par ro zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par ro zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: The meaning of this sūtra passage is clearly that appearance is the conventional and nonappearance is the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa'i don mi 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar re zhig dam bcas pa'i don mi 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the meaning of the thesis is not contradictory.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du yang dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du yang dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: You should not doubt that the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po rnams rang las skye bar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig dngos po rnams rang las skye bar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, first, it is not logical that things arise from themselves,

original: rang gi ngo bo yod pa dang med pa bdag nyid kyi rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod pa dang med pa bdag nyid kyi rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that an existent or nonexistent essential nature is a cause.

original: dngos po'i rgyu rang gi ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu rang gi ngo bo yin na /
translated: If the cause of a thing is its essential nature,

original: yod pa'am med pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: it must be either existent or nonexistent.

original: re zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not existent,

original: de la cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir ri 'bigs byed dang gangs can bzhin no //
analyzed: de la cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir ri 'bigs byed dang gangs can bzhin no //
translated: because it is not in the least necessary, like the Vindhya and Himalaya mountains.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa de'i tshe nyid na de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po yang grub zin pas de las rgyu'i bya ba med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa de'i tshe nyid na de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po yang grub zin pas de las rgyu'i bya ba med de /
translated: When the essential nature of a thing is established, then at that time, since it is not different from that, the thing is also already established. Therefore, a cause does not function with regard to it,

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: gang grub na gang zhig mi 'grub pa de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang grub na gang zhig mi 'grub pa de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that that which is established and that which is not established are the essential nature of that.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that all things would be the cause of all things.

original: tha dad pa ma yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If they were not different, it would not make sense for them to be cause and effect.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of those two is difference.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'bras bu'o 'di ni rgyu'o zhes de'i tha snyad ma 'chol bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'bras bu'o 'di ni rgyu'o zhes de'i tha snyad ma 'chol bar 'dogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that were not so, then because there would be no cause of their difference, it would be impossible to designate them unerringly as this is the effect and this is the cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes ming btags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur bar zad de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes ming btags pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur bar zad de /
translated: They would be merely designated as cause and effect.

original: ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
translated: But there is no dispute over names.

original: ci ste gnas skabs tha dad pa rgyu yin par rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste gnas skabs tha dad pa rgyu yin par rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that the difference in states is the cause,

original: gal te de lta na 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo kho na rgyur mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo kho na rgyur mi 'grub ste /
translated: then in that case, the entity itself is not established as the cause,

original: gnas skabs rnams dang gnas po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams dang gnas po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the states and the entity that abides are not different.

original: gnas skabs tha dad par khas len na ni de dang 'dra bar gnas po yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad par khas len na ni de dang 'dra bar gnas po yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the states are different, then just as they are different, the entity that abides would also be different.

original: de'i phyir rna cha gdub kor la sogs pa rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi gser gyi rdzas kyang gzhan kho na yin la /🔽dpung rgyan la sogs pa 'bras @276a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rna cha gdub kor la sogs pa rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi gser gyi rdzas kyang gzhan kho na yin la / dpung rgyan la sogs pa 'bras @276a * //
translated: Therefore, the substance of gold in the causal period, such as earrings and bracelets, is entirely different from the substance of gold in the resultant period, such as armlets and so on.

original: bu'i gnas skabs kyi yang gzhan kho na yin na /
analyzed: bu'i gnas skabs kyi yang gzhan kho na yin na /
translated: If you say that the substance of gold is the cause of the resultant period,

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be the cause in its own nature?

original: ci ste gnas po dang 'dra na ni gnas skabs gnyis kyang gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gnas po dang 'dra na ni gnas skabs gnyis kyang gcig pa'i ngo bor 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is like the abider, then the two periods would have the same nature.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa so na 'dug pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa so na 'dug pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the error remains.

original: de lta ma yin na gnas po dang gnas skabs rnams tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnas po dang gnas skabs rnams tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, the abider and the periods would be entirely different,

original: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the same in terms of establishment and pleasure.

original: yang tha dad par khas len na ni gnas skabs dag kho na rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang tha dad par khas len na ni gnas skabs dag kho na rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that they are different, then the periods themselves would be cause and effect,

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: but not their own nature.

original: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa ni gser la sogs pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na ngo bo nyid 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa ni gser la sogs pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is the arising of another that is similar in nature to the former that is mistaken for the permanence of gold, etc., and the convention “This is that very thing” is applied to it.

original: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong nas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not seen that that very thing becomes another.

original: de nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
translated: That very thing does not become another,

original: de kho na dang gzhan ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na dang gzhan ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because thatness and another are characteristics that exclude each other.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i de kho na ni yongs su gcod pa na gzhan nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la gzhan nyid kyang de nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i de kho na ni yongs su gcod pa na gzhan nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod la gzhan nyid kyang de nyid rnam par bcad nas yongs su gcod do //
translated: Thus, when the thatness of a thing is ascertained, another is excluded, and when another is ascertained, that very thing is excluded.

original: de las bzlog pa'i rnam par bcad na ni yongs su gcod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rnam par bcad na ni yongs su gcod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the opposite of that is excluded, then it is not ascertained at all.

original: gang rnam par bcad pa med par gang yongs su gcod pa med pa de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang rnam par bcad pa med par gang yongs su gcod pa med pa de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: That which is not excluded and that which is not ascertained are characteristics that exclude each other.

original: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag kyang chos can gcig la cig car 'dur mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de dag kyang chos can gcig la cig car 'dur mi rung ba ste /
translated: Those which are characterized by mutual exclusion cannot be combined in one basis at one time.

original: dper na lus dang lus med pa tha dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus dang lus med pa tha dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the difference between having a body and not having a body.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad rdzas gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad rdzas gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then everything would be only one substance.

original: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that they would arise and perish together.

original: de lta bas na de nyid gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dir rmongs pa rab tu mang pos spungs bskyed par zad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dir rmongs pa rab tu mang pos spungs bskyed par zad do //
translated: Thus, this “that very thing becomes something else” is just a heap of the confusion of many.

original: gzhan yang yongs su 'gyur ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su 'gyur ba zhig yin na /
translated: Moreover, if there is transformation,

original: ngo bo snga ma yongs su bor nas sam /
analyzed: ngo bo snga ma yongs su bor nas sam /
translated: does it transform after completely abandoning the previous nature,🔽or does it transform without completely abandoning it?

original: yongs su ma bor nas 'gyur grags de bzhin du chos dag gam /
analyzed: yongs su ma bor nas 'gyur grags de bzhin du chos dag gam /
translated: In the same way, does the attribute transform, or does the basis of the attribute transform?

original: chos can zhig 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
analyzed: chos can zhig 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
translated: Thus, one should investigate.

original: de la gal te yongs su bor nas zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po ni cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma'i ngo bo ni bdag @276b nyid thams cad kyis rnam par zhig na rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo nyid🔽'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
analyzed: de la gal te yongs su bor nas zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po ni cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma'i ngo bo ni bdag @276b nyid thams cad kyis rnam par zhig na rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
translated: If the position is that it is completely abandoned, then at that time, since the thing is partless, the previous entity would be completely destroyed by itself, and how could it be that it has no subsequent entity?

original: 'on te yongs su ma bor nas zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na na de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te yongs su ma bor nas zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na na de'i tshe gnas skabs 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the position is that it is not completely abandoned, then at that time there would be a confused state.

original: des na rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'ang bus ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgan po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'ang bus ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even in the state of being an old man and so on, the state of being a child and so on would be observed.

original: chos dag kyang 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dag kyang 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not right to say that phenomena change,

original: de dag ni de dang tha mi dad pa nyid pas chos can ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag ni de dang tha mi dad pa nyid pas chos can ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are not different from that. The entity of the phenomenon is the same as its nature.

original: chos can yang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can yang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid pas chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the basis of the phenomenon is not different from the phenomenon, it follows that it arises and disintegrates in the same way that the phenomenon does.

original: de lta ma yin na chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, the phenomenon and the basis of the phenomenon would be different.

original: de'i tshe chos snga ma ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'jig la /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos snga ma ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'jig la /
translated: In that case, the phenomenon would disintegrate without any cause,

original: sngon med pa'i chos ni 'byung bas gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i chos ni 'byung bas gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: and a phenomenon that did not exist previously would arise.

original: tha dad pa yin na chos dang chos can gyi dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na chos dang chos can gyi dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If they were different, it would not be logical for them to be the phenomenon and the basis of the phenomenon,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: chos can yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The basis of the phenomenon does not change,

original: de ni khyod kyi lugs kyis dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyod kyi lugs kyis dus thams cad du ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because according to your system, it is the same entity at all times.

original: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar mi rigs par yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar mi rigs par yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has already been proven that it is illogical for it to change into something else.

original: gzhan yang gal te chos can de rang bzhin gyis brtan pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te chos can de rang bzhin gyis brtan pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the basis of the phenomenon is stable by its very nature,

original: de'i tshe de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: How could it be different at that time?

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu ngo bo gcig pa ni rang gi ngo bo snga ma ma bor bar gzhan du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bu ngo bo gcig pa ni rang gi ngo bo snga ma ma bor bar gzhan du 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a single nature, like space, etc., becomes different without abandoning its prior nature.

original: mi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that its nature would be unstable.

original: 'o na mi brtan pa'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: 'o na mi brtan pa'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is unstable,

original: de'i tshe g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas rgyu med par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas rgyu med par 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then at that time, because it has a nature that moves, it would be destroyed without a cause.

original: de phyi mar mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyi mar mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not endure later, it would not become different.

original: de lta bas na 'gyur bar smra ba 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gyur bar smra ba 'di ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this theory of change is not good.

original: de lta na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, because it does not perform any function,

original: rang gi ngo bo yod pa yang bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod pa yang bdag nyid kyi rgyu'i dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: an existent nature also does not exist as the entity of its cause.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it nonexistent,

original: de yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas cung zad mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas cung zad mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by being devoid of all ability, and therefore it does not perform any function.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: This is the definition of nonexistence:

original: 'di ltar nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //🔽gang zhig nus pa'i nor ma lus pa dang bral ba @277a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'o // gang zhig nus pa'i nor ma lus pa dang bral ba @277a * //
translated: it is the absence of all ability.🔽How can something that is devoid of all ability🔽to benefit or to harm

original: des ji ltar phan 'dogs par nus te /🔽phan pa'i rgyu ni nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji ltar phan 'dogs par nus te / phan pa'i rgyu ni nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: be a cause of benefit or harm?

original: de lta bas na grangs can la sogs pas dngos po rnams rang skye bar yongs su brtags pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na grangs can la sogs pas dngos po rnams rang skye bar yongs su brtags pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for the Sāṃkhya and others to imagine that things arise from themselves.

original: gzhan las shes bya'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las shes bya'i phyogs kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable for things to arise from something other than themselves.

original: 'di ltar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur na /🔽rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan las skye bar 'gyur na / rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'am /
translated: If things were to arise from something other than themselves,🔽would they arise from something permanent or impermanent?

original: gnyi ga'am gnyi ga ma yin pa las 'gyur grang zhes brtag ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'am gnyi ga ma yin pa las 'gyur grang zhes brtag ste /
translated: Or would they arise from both or from neither?

original: re zhig rtag pa'i dngos po ci yang med pa'i phyir rtag pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rtag pa'i dngos po ci yang med pa'i phyir rtag pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: First, things do not arise from something permanent, because there is no permanent thing at all.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po der yongs su brtag na /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po der yongs su brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that a permanent thing exists,

original: don byed nus pa zhig la rgyur yongs su brtag ste /
analyzed: don byed nus pa zhig la rgyur yongs su brtag ste /
translated: then you must imagine that it is a cause that is able to perform a function.

original: dper na gzhan dag gis bdag la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur yongs su brtags pa lta bu zhig gam mi nus pa zhig pa ste /
analyzed: dper na gzhan dag gis bdag la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur yongs su brtags pa lta bu zhig gam mi nus pa zhig pa ste /
translated: For example, it is like the imputation of self and so on as the cause of pleasure and so forth by others.

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis nam mkha' la sogs pa gsum nus pa med pa kho na la dngos po nyid du yongs su brtags pa lta bu zhig yin grang na /🔽de la don byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis nam mkha' la sogs pa gsum nus pa med pa kho na la dngos po nyid du yongs su brtags pa lta bu zhig yin grang na / de la don byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or is it like the imputation of the three, space and so on, as things that are simply devoid of the capacity to perform functions by Vaibhāṣikas?

original: rtag pa ni kun rdzob tu yang rim dang cig shos dag gis don byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni kun rdzob tu yang rim dang cig shos dag gis don byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that that which is able to perform a function is permanent because it is untenable that a permanent thing performs a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa yin na yang res 'ga' yang 'bras bu mi skyed par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa yin na yang res 'ga' yang 'bras bu mi skyed par mi 'grub la /
translated: Even if a cause is unobstructed in its capacity, it is not established that it never generates a result.

original: 'bras bu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can yin na nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If a result is not incomplete with respect to its cause, it will never arise.

original: gang gis na rim gyis don bya ba byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rim gyis don bya ba byed par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would it perform a function gradually?

original: gzhan dag gis phogs dbyung du med pa ni ltos pa ci yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis phogs dbyung du med pa ni ltos pa ci yang med na /
translated: If it is not dependent on anything else,

original: gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos nas res 'ga' 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos nas res 'ga' 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: then how could it sometimes not generate an effect in dependence on its cooperative conditions?

original: gzhan yang bya ba byed pa'i dus na de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen thams cad nye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i dus su rjes su 'brang bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rjes
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba byed pa'i dus na de'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen thams cad nye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i dus su rjes su 'brang bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin rjes
translated: Moreover, if you assert that the nature of all the cooperative conditions that exist at the time of performing an action is the same as the nature of the cooperative conditions that exist at the time of being free of cooperative conditions, then at that time the nature that is related to the cooperative conditions would follow the nature that is free of cooperative conditions.

original: su 'brang bas nan gyis mgul nas lcags thag gis dam rab tu btags pa 'dra bar 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du rtag tu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams dang nye ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: su 'brang bas nan gyis mgul nas lcags thag gis dam rab tu btags pa 'dra bar 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du rtag tu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams dang nye ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the nature that is related to the cooperative conditions is like the nature that is free of cooperative conditions, then the nature that is related to the cooperative conditions would always be the same as the nature that is free of cooperative conditions, just as the nature that is free of cooperative conditions is always the same as the nature that is related to the cooperative conditions.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa dang mi 'bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa dang mi 'bral ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would always be inseparable from the cooperative conditions.

original: 'bras bu yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that the effect is dependent on the cause,

original: med @277b pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: med @277b pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: because it does not exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa'i phyir blos yongs su brtags pa la ltos nas med pa la yang blos rnam par gzhag mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'thob pa'i phyir blos yongs su brtags pa la ltos nas med pa la yang blos rnam par gzhag mod kyi /
translated: Although the non-existent is posited by the mind in dependence on the mental imputation that obtains the nature connected with it,

original: de lta na yang de mngon par 'grub par bya ba la des rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid la phan 'dogs par ltos par bya'i /
analyzed: de lta na yang de mngon par 'grub par bya ba la des rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid la phan 'dogs par ltos par bya'i /
translated: nevertheless, in order for it to be accomplished, it must be dependent on the assistance of that very unobstructed power that is its cause.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on anything else.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bus rtog par 'dod pa'i dngos po rtag tu phan 'dogs pa nyid du nye bar nus pa thogs pa med pa de nyid bor nas gzhan la ltos ci dgos te /🔽des 'di la gnod pa byas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bus rtog par 'dod pa'i dngos po rtag tu phan 'dogs pa nyid du nye bar nus pa thogs pa med pa de nyid bor nas gzhan la ltos ci dgos te / des 'di la gnod pa byas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, what need is there to abandon that very unobstructed power that is always able to assist the entity that is asserted to be the effect and to depend on something else?🔽There is not the slightest harm done to it by that,

original: gzhan dag gis 'di la phan btags pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'di la phan btags pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: or assistance to it by others.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la ltos la ni rag na 'on kyang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gang yin pa de nus pa thogs pa med pa yin na go ltos ci dgos /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la ltos la ni rag na 'on kyang dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gang yin pa de nus pa thogs pa med pa yin na go ltos ci dgos /
translated: Moreover, if the effect is dependent on the conditions that are its co-originators, then what need is there for a God, etc., as a cause, since the cause is unobstructed power?

original: gang gis na de skyer mi 'dod pa bzhin du yang nan gyis drangs te skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: gang gis na de skyer mi 'dod pa bzhin du yang nan gyis drangs te skyed par mi byed /
translated: If that is so, then why does the cause not generate the effect when it does not wish to generate it?

original: de lta na des bdag nyid kyi mthu nye bar brtan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na des bdag nyid kyi mthu nye bar brtan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, the power of the cause would be unstable.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be stable.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu med pa ltos par rigs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu med pa ltos par rigs pa ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that an existent effect is dependent.

original: yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it logical that a nonexistent effect is dependent.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo mtha' dag thob pa nyid kyis thams cad la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo mtha' dag thob pa nyid kyis thams cad la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is nonexistent, it is like the son of a barren woman and does not exist.

original: gal te 'di snyam du de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du de gnyis tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the effect does not conform to all the qualities of the cause because it would then follow that they are not different,

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gnyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gnyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, without a doubt, those two are different in some way.

original: des na rim ma yin pa las kyang 'bras bu rim can mi 'gal ba nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na rim ma yin pa las kyang 'bras bu rim can mi 'gal ba nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not contradictory that effects arise in sequence even though their causes are not sequential,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: kho bo cag kyang 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed do zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang 'bras bu rgyu'i chos thams cad kyi rjes su byed do zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that effects conform to all the attributes of their causes.

original: 'on kyang re zhig gdon mi za bar 'bras bus rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i ni rjes su bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig gdon mi za bar 'bras bus rgyu la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i ni rjes su bya dgos te /
translated: However, effects must conform to the presence or absence of causes.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro//
translated: That is the extent of the cause and effect relationship.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' yang rgyu rtag par 'dod pa la yod pa'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' yang rgyu rtag par 'dod pa la yod pa'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni med do //
translated: There is no effect that conforms to the absence of a permanent cause.

original: rtag pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a permanent thing cannot be absent.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rtag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rtag pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were otherwise, it would be permanent.

original: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not permanent.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te /🔽de ril gyis nye yang res 'ga' 'bras @278a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa yang ma yin te / de ril gyis nye yang res 'ga' 'bras @278a * //
translated: Nor does it follow the activity of the one who is to be followed,

original: bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it is always near, sometimes the effect does not occur.

original: gang zhig gang la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de na de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin ta /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de na de'i 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin ta /
translated: And if something does not follow the existence of something else, it is not reasonable that it be its effect,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the effect of anything.

original: de ltar na re zhig rtag pas rim gyis don byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rtag pas rim gyis don byed par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, first, the permanent is unable to function sequentially.

original: cig car yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it able to function all at once,

original: phyis bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i rjes su 'brang na 'bras bu skye ba dang bral bar mi rung ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i rjes su 'brang na 'bras bu skye ba dang bral bar mi rung ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: because if it were to follow the nature of functioning later, then it would be impossible for the effect to arise, as before.

original: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams so //
translated: And if it does not follow it, then its permanence is undermined.

original: rim dang cig car dag las gzhan pa gang gis don byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag las gzhan pa gang gis don byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
translated: Apart from sequentially and all at once, there is no other way for it to function.

original: de gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa nyid kyis phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par bcad pa med na yongs su gcod pa med pa nyid kyis phan tshun spangs te /
translated: These two are mutually exclusive, because if one is not excluded, the other is not ascertained.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are mutually exclusive, and if one is not excluded, the other is not ascertained, they are characteristics that are mutually exclusive.

original: nus pa ma lus pas stong pa dngos po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ma lus pas stong pa dngos po nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not reasonable for a thing to be empty of all abilities, because that would lead to the absurd conclusion that

original: de lta na ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: even the son of a barren woman would be a thing.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu ci yang ma grub pas dngos po med par chung zad kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med par tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu ci yang ma grub pas dngos po med par chung zad kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since no cause for the designation of a nonthing is established at all, not even a little nonthing would be established.

original: de ma grub na dngos po yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ma grub na dngos po yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: If that is not established, a thing is not established either,

original: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcad pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gcad pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the exclusion of its opposite is not established.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma log pa'i rang bzhin ni cung zad kyang rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma log pa'i rang bzhin ni cung zad kyang rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
translated: A nature that is not distinguished from its opposite cannot be ascertained in the least as its own nature.

original: de lta bas na don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba kho na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid yin la //
analyzed: de lta bas na don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba kho na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid yin la //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the nature of the rabbit’s horns and so on is only that which lacks the capacity to perform a function.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: It is logical to say that the opposite of that is the definition of a thing.

original: des na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang khyad par med par so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams dngos por tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang khyad par med par so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams dngos por tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical for those who understand that analytical cessations and so on are not different from the rabbit’s horns and so on to impute them as things.

original: de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have no cause.

original: 'di ltar gal te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa de 'ga' zhig gi shes pa'i yul du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa de 'ga' zhig gi shes pa'i yul du 'gyur na ni /
translated: In this way, if those analytical cessations and so on are the objects of some consciousness,

original: de'i tshe de'i gdon mi za bar de'i rgyu'i dngos por khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i gdon mi za bar de'i rgyu'i dngos por khas blangs dgos te /
translated: then at that time it is definitely necessary to accept that they are the cause of that consciousness,

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyu yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyu yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not a cause is not the object of a cause.

original: rgyu'i khyad par kho na rang gi rnam par 'jog pas rnam par shes pa la phan pa byed pa na yul yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par kho na rang gi rnam par 'jog pas rnam par shes pa la phan pa byed pa na yul yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is posited as a cause that is a specific kind of entity, when it benefits consciousness, it is said to be an object.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rtag pa de'i rtag @278b pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rtag pa de'i rtag @278b pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then the permanence of that permanent thing would be undermined,

original: gang du yang rim dang cig car dag gi rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du yang rim dang cig car dag gi rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be suitable as a cause in any way, either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: 'on te phan mi 'dogs bzhin du yang rnam par shes pa'i yul du rtog na ni de'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'brang bas de'i rnam par shes pa yang de'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar rtag par rjes su 'brang ba'i
analyzed: 'on te phan mi 'dogs bzhin du yang rnam par shes pa'i yul du rtog na ni de'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'brang bas de'i rnam par shes pa yang de'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar rtag par rjes su 'brang ba'i
translated: But if you imagine that it is an object of consciousness even though it does not benefit it, then since the nature of that consciousness would be completely uniform, its consciousness would also be uniform.

original: phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is permanent.

original: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par thal ba bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi 'brang na ni de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par thal ba bzlog dka'o //
translated: If it is not uniform, then it is difficult to avoid the consequence that its permanence is undermined.

original: 'on te tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyang rung 'ga'i yul gyi dngos por yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes rtog par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te tha na thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyang rung 'ga'i yul gyi dngos por yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes rtog par byed na /
translated: But if you think that it does not approach the state of being an object of even the omniscient mind,

original: de'i tshe mkhas pa rnams de la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mkhas pa rnams de la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not reasonable for the wise to designate it as a thing.

original: rnam pa shes pa der tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa shes pa der tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for designating consciousness in that way.

original: de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa shin tu med pa las kyang gang gis na de las tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba khyad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa shin tu med pa las kyang gang gis na de las tha dad par bsgrub par bya ba khyad par bya dgos te /
translated: And it is not different from a rabbit’s horns, which are utterly nonexistent, so it must be established as something different from that.

original: dngos po med pa las rnam par ma phye ba'i rang bzhin ni dngos po nyid du rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa las rnam par ma phye ba'i rang bzhin ni dngos po nyid du rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: Because a nature that is not distinguished from nonexistence cannot be understood to be a thing.

original: de'i khyad par bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod do zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod do zhes brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that its difference is the apprehension of its own nature,

original: dngos po med pa la yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la yang nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gi ngo bo 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonexistence also has the apprehension of its own nature, which is characterized by the absence of all ability.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu de la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de lta bu de la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
translated: If you designate something that is not different from the son of a barren woman as a thing, then there is no dispute about the name.

original: 'on kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer bas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dpyod par byed pa de dag ni shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer bas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dpyod par byed pa de dag ni shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang khyad par
translated: However, those who are rational and seek to be effective in their pursuits analyze the nature of things. They do not observe anything that is not different from the son of a barren woman, which is utterly devoid of nature and all capacity.

original: med pa de lta bu de la tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni legs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: med pa de lta bu de la tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni legs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no cause for designating it, it is not correct to posit it as a thing.

original: smras pa / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: smras pa / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
translated: Objection: It is not able to perform a function.

original: de'i don gnyer bas dpyad ci phan //🔽ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: de'i don gnyer bas dpyad ci phan // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
translated: What is the use of analyzing it for those who seek its object?

original: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
translated: What is the use of the desirous analyzing whether a eunuch is handsome or ugly?

original: de ltar na rtag pa nyid kyis dngos po ci yang med pas rtag pa las skye ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtag pa nyid kyis dngos po ci yang med pas rtag pa las skye ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since nothing exists due to permanence, it is illogical that an effect arises from a permanent cause.

original: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from a impermanent cause.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa las 'bras bu skye ba na rgyu 'das pa las skya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa las 'bras bu skye ba na rgyu 'das pa las skya ste /
translated: If an effect arises from an impermanent cause, it arises from a past cause.

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams @279a * //🔽kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa las kyang 'bras bu nye bar brjod pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba rnams @279a * // kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa las kyang 'bras bu nye bar brjod pa lta bu'am /
translated: For example, the Vaibhāṣikas say that🔽an effect is said to arise from a past cause that is a ripening cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa las te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las te /
translated: Or it arises from a future cause.🔽For example, they impute that future arising generates that which is to be generated.

original: dper na de dag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni bskyed par bya ba skyed pa yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na de dag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni bskyed par bya ba skyed pa yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa lta bu'am /
translated: Or it arises from a present cause.

original: da ltar gyi las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs shig yin grang na /🔽de la re zhig 'das pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi las skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs shig yin grang na / de la re zhig 'das pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs ni rung ba ma yin te /
translated: If it arises from a present cause,🔽then first, the position that it arises from a past cause is not tenable because

original: 'das pa'i dngos po yod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dngos po yod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: a past thing does not exist.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba ci zhes bya /
translated: What is called past?

original: rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'am /
translated: Has it not degenerated from its own nature?

original: rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa yin grang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las nyams pa yin grang /
translated: Or has it degenerated from its own nature?

original: de lta ma yin na da ltar bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma nyams pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das pa yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na da ltar bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma nyams pa'i phyir ji ltar 'das pa yin /
translated: If it is not like that, then like the present, it has not degenerated from its own nature, so how can it be past?

original: gang rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i bdag nyid de yang med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed de /
analyzed: gang rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i bdag nyid de yang med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed de /
