translated: And that which has degenerated from its own nature is nonexistent by nature, so how can it generate an effect?

original: don byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the performance of an object’s function depends on its own nature.

original: 'on te byed pa zhig pa las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa zhig pa las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the past is not the state of having ceased of that which performs an action, nor is it the state of having degenerated from its own nature,

original: de lta yang de'i byed pa zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang de'i byed pa zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not tenable that an effect arises from the state of having ceased of that which performs an action.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it is not like that,

original: 'bras bu skyed na ji ltar zhig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed na ji ltar zhig par 'gyur /
translated: then if it generates an effect, how could it have ceased?

original: 'bras bu gcig la dngos po'i ngo bo gcig gis rim gyis 'phel ba dang / rab tu skyed pa'i mthu tha dad par rigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig la dngos po'i ngo bo gcig gis rim gyis 'phel ba dang / rab tu skyed pa'i mthu tha dad par rigs pa ma yin na /
translated: It is not tenable that a single entity generates an effect by the power of a gradual increase of its own nature.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu 'phen pa tsam byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu 'phen pa tsam byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it would be the mere projector of the effect,

original: rab tu byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ma yin /
translated: not the producer.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir de 'phen pa'i dus kho na rab tu skyed par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir de 'phen pa'i dus kho na rab tu skyed par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And because there would be no difference, it would produce it at the very time it projects it.

original: de lta ma yin na ni phyis kyang snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rab tu skyed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang byed pa zhes bya ba de gal te nus pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni phyis kyang snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rab tu skyed par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang byed pa zhes bya ba de gal te nus pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: If it were not so, then later on also it would not produce it, because it would be no different from before.🔽Moreover, if this so-called activity is the nature of potentiality,

original: bya ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: bya ba'i ngo bo zhig yin par 'gyur grang /
translated: or the nature of action,

original: re zhig gal te gnyi ga don gzhan yin na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te gnyi ga don gzhan yin na ni /
translated: then, first, if both are different objects,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar re zhig ces brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar re zhig ces brjod par bya /
translated: then how could it be said that “at one time”?

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo zhig pa'i phyir na ni de'i tshe rtag tu dngos po thams cad yod par smra ba nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo zhig pa'i phyir na ni de'i tshe rtag tu dngos po thams cad yod par smra ba nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is because of the destruction of its own nature, then at that time the assertion that all things exist is undermined.

original: don gzhan de zhig na yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi g-yo ba 'jig par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan de zhig na yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi g-yo ba 'jig par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And even if that different object is destroyed, the destruction of the unmoving nature of the thing is not established.

original: lha sbyin shi bar gyur bas mchod sbyin rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yang 'chi ba ni med do //
analyzed: lha sbyin shi bar gyur bas mchod sbyin rang gi ngo bo las ma nyams pa'i ngo bo yang 'chi ba ni med do //
translated: The sacrifice does not perish through the death of Yajnadatta, because it does not perish by intrinsic nature.

original: 'on te byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it perishes because of the death of the agent,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical,

original: thug pa @279b med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa la byed pa gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: thug pa @279b med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa la byed pa gzhan ni med de /
translated: because an infinite regress would ensue. The agent does not perish through another agent,

original: de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same objection applies to that.

original: de'i phyir 'ga' yang 'jig par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ga' yang 'jig par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, nothing is established as perishable.

original: byed pa don gzhan pa nyid yin na ni dngos po'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa don gzhan pa nyid yin na ni dngos po'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the agent is something other than the object, it is not the cause of the object,

original: byed pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: byed pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the effect arises from the agent alone.

original: / de'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that the object is nonexistent,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of an object is that it is able to perform a function.

original: byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de yang 'bras bu skyed pa na gal te byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas skyed par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po yang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas 'bras
analyzed: byed pa don gzhan du gyur pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de yang 'bras bu skyed pa na gal te byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas skyed par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po yang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas 'bras
translated: If you assert that the entity itself generates the effect by the entity of the agent alone, then at that time, the entity itself would generate the effect by the entity of the agent alone,

original: bu skyed par 'gyur na don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bu skyed par 'gyur na don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: so what would be the point of positing another object?

original: 'on te gzhan du gyur pas skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du gyur pas skyed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say it is generated by the other,

original: de'i tshe de la yang byed pa gzhan du rtog na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang gi yang rgyu nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la yang byed pa gzhan du rtog na thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang gi yang rgyu nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: then if you imagine another agent for that, there would be an infinite regress, and it would not be established as the cause of anything.

original: dngos po phan par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di'i byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang ma 'grub ste 'brel pa ni thams cad du phan pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phan par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di'i byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang ma 'grub ste 'brel pa ni thams cad du phan pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the entity is not beneficial, it is not established that this is its agent, because in all cases, a connection is distinguished by benefit.

original: 'on te yang de la dngos po phan 'dogs pa nyid du khas len na ni de'i tshe dngos po byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dbang gis byed pa la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe ci'i phyir 'bras bu la de ltar phan 'dogs par mi byed /
analyzed: 'on te yang de la dngos po phan 'dogs pa nyid du khas len na ni de'i tshe dngos po byed pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i dbang gis byed pa la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe ci'i phyir 'bras bu la de ltar phan 'dogs par mi byed /
translated: But if you accept that the entity is helpful to the agent, then at that time, since the entity would be the nature of the agent, it would be helpful to the agent. But in that case, why wouldn’t it be helpful to the effect?

original: gang gis na byed pa don gzhan du nye bar brtag / byed pa dngos po yod pa tsam la rag las pa yin na yang rtag tu rgyu ril gyis nye ba'i phyir 'jig pa 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis na byed pa don gzhan du nye bar brtag / byed pa dngos po yod pa tsam la rag las pa yin na yang rtag tu rgyu ril gyis nye ba'i phyir 'jig pa 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the agent were conceived to be a different object, then even if the agent were dependent on the mere existence of the entity, since the cause would always be present, cessation would not be established.

original: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pas phan 'dogs na ni de'i tshe de dang der 'brel par yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pas phan 'dogs na ni de'i tshe de dang der 'brel par yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: But if it were helpful as a different object, then at that time it would not be established as related to that.

original: de'i tshe byed pa rnams kho na rgyud mar sbyor ba'i phyir dngos po ni gyi na 'dug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byed pa rnams kho na rgyud mar sbyor ba'i phyir dngos po ni gyi na 'dug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, since the agents would be connected in a series, the entity would remain as it is.

original: byed pa bya ba'i ngo bo yin par yang skad cig ma rnams ni skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa kho na la skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang rtag tu ngo bo gcig par gnas pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du
analyzed: byed pa bya ba'i ngo bo yin par yang skad cig ma rnams ni skyes ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pa kho na la skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams kyang rtag tu ngo bo gcig par gnas pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du
translated: Also, it is illogical for permanent things to be related to activity because they always endure with a single nature, like space.

original: bya ba dang 'brel par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid pas bya ba zhes bya ba gang la yang med do //
analyzed: bya ba dang 'brel par rigs pa ma yin pa nyid pas bya ba zhes bya ba gang la yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since they do not exist, action does not exist.🔽Thus, when a result is generated that is ascertained by its own nature alone, it is ascertained by its own causes and conditions because it is its very essence.

original: de lta bas na rang gi ngo bo tsam kho nas so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa na rang gi rgyu rkyen gyis nges par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho na la nus pa dang bya ba
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi ngo bo tsam kho nas so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu nye bar skyed pa na rang gi rgyu rkyen gyis nges par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho na la nus pa dang bya ba
translated: Therefore, the essence of things is said to be potent, active,

original: la @280a * //🔽sogs pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
analyzed: la @280a * // sogs pa'i sgrar brjod kyi /
translated: and so on.

original: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not another object.

original: dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i byed pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de zhig ste rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na dngos po yang de dang tha mi dad pas rang gi ngo bo nyams na ji ltar 'das pa yod pa nyid du 'grub
analyzed: dngos po dang tha mi dad pa'i byed pa gnyi ga'i ngo bo de zhig ste rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i mtshan nyid gcig yin na dngos po yang de dang tha mi dad pas rang gi ngo bo nyams na ji ltar 'das pa yod pa nyid du 'grub
translated: If both the entity and the action that is not different from it have the same nature, and if that nature is destroyed, then since the entity is not different from that, how could the past be established as existent?

original: / byed pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mi 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas byed pa zhig par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: / byed pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mi 'jig par thal bar 'gyur bas byed pa zhig par mi 'grub po //
translated: And because the action is not different from it, it follows that it would not be destroyed, just like the entity’s own nature. Therefore the destruction of the action is not established.

original: 'on te byed pa de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin par rtog na /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin par rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that the action is neither the same as nor different from that,

original: de'i tshe 'di brtags pa'i yod pa nyid yin pas dngos po med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa don dam pa par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di brtags pa'i yod pa nyid yin pas dngos po med pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa don dam pa par mi 'grub po //
translated: then since it would exist only as an imputation, it would not be an entity. Therefore the presentation of the three times would not be established as ultimate.

original: dngos po ni rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for an entity to be inexpressible in any way.

original: thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would be inexpressible.

original: de lta bas na 'das pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'das pa las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'das pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'das pa las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because a past entity does not exist, an effect does not arise from a past cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from a future cause,

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang gi ngo bor ma red pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang gi ngo bor ma red pa la bya'o //
translated: because that which is called “future” is not yet established in its own nature.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: da ltar bzhin du rang gi ngo bo mi g-yo bar 'dzin na /
analyzed: da ltar bzhin du rang gi ngo bo mi g-yo bar 'dzin na /
translated: if it were apprehended as unchanging in its own nature, just as it is in the present,

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be established as future?

original: bdag gi de kho nar ma red pa gang yin pa de las ni nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi de kho nar ma red pa gang yin pa de las ni nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that an effect arises from that which is not yet established in its own reality, just as it is not reasonable that an effect arises from a sky flower.

original: 'on te byed pa ma thob pas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de las 'bras bu skye bar yang shin tu yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa ma thob pas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de las 'bras bu skye bar yang shin tu yang mi rigs te /
translated: But if it is called “future” because it has not yet obtained its activity, then it is quite unreasonable that an effect arises from it,

original: byed pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not yet obtained its activity.

original: rtag tu dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid yin na de 'thob pa'i rgyu rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir res 'ga' la las byed pa mi 'thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu dngos po thams cad yod pa nyid yin na de 'thob pa'i rgyu rnams ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ci'i phyir res 'ga' la las byed pa mi 'thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: If all things always exist, then since the causes for obtaining them are not incomplete, why would one not always obtain the activity of the effect?

original: byed po dngos po gzhan du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ni dpyad zin to //🔽don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin yang gi ngo bo yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir byed pa bzhin du ma thob pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du mi 'grub par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: byed po dngos po gzhan du rigs pa ma yin no zhes ni dpyad zin to // don gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin yang gi ngo bo yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir byed pa bzhin du ma thob pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du mi 'grub par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: It has already been analyzed that it is not logical for an agent to be a different thing.🔽Even if it is not a different object, since its nature is not different from that, it follows that it is not obtained, like the activity. Thus, the existence of the future would not be established.

original: byed pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin ma thob pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa ma thob pa nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa yang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin ma thob pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byed pa ma thob pa nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, since the activity itself is not different from that, it follows that it is not obtained, like the nature of the thing itself. Thus, the nonobtainment of the activity would not be established.

original: de lta bas na ma @280b 'ongs pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma @280b 'ongs pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir de las 'bras bu skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the future does not exist, it is illogical for an effect to arise from it.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rgyu med pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu rgyu med pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then it would follow that the effect would be causeless.

original: de la 'og nas 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: de la 'og nas 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: There is the fault that will be explained below.

original: da ltar gyi las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi las zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position that the present karma is the cause of the effect is also not tenable.

original: 'di ltar de las 'bras bu skye ba na du ma las gcig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar de las 'bras bu skye ba na du ma las gcig gam /
translated: When an effect arises from that karma, does one effect arise from many causes?

original: du ma zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'am /🔽gcig las du ma'am /
analyzed: du ma zhig skye bar 'gyur ba'am / gcig las du ma'am /
translated: Or do many effects arise?🔽Or does one effect arise from many causes?

original: gcig skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gcig skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or does one cause give rise to many effects?🔽Or do many causes give rise to many effects?

original: 'bras bu du ma gcig gi rang gi ngo bo de yang rgyu dang dus mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu du ma gcig gi rang gi ngo bo de yang rgyu dang dus mnyam pa'am /
translated: Or does an effect that is the nature of one arise from causes that are simultaneous with it?

original: dus tha dad pa zhig tu skye bar 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa zhig tu skye bar 'gyur grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
translated: Or does it arise at a different time?

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed par 'gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed par 'gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, if it is the first possibility, then at that time the effect would not be made different by the difference of the cause.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa ras yug la sogs pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i tha dad pas byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa ras yug la sogs pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i tha dad pas byas pa yin gyi /
translated: In this way, whatever is a different nature from cloth, etc., is made by the difference of the cause.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it would follow that they would be causeless, they are not by nature.

original: de la gal te rgyu tha dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu tha dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ma yin pa ni rgyu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If, although the cause is not different, the effect were different, then because of error, the difference of the effect would not be made by the difference or non-difference of the cause.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas thams cad rgyu med pa can kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pas thams cad rgyu med pa can kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no entity apart from difference and non-difference, it follows that everything would be causeless.

original: ci ste yang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rgyu rnams kyis nye bar sbyar bar byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par ma 'chol ba'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad pa kho nar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rgyu rnams kyis nye bar sbyar bar byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par ma 'chol ba'i phyir rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad pa kho nar byed pa yin te /
translated: But if the causes, as they are, make the difference of the effect by producing the particularities of its own nature without confusion,

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba na dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor nges pa'i yul can dang /🔽yul gyi rnam pa nye bar gyur pa skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye ba na dngos su tha dad pa ma yin yang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor nges pa'i yul can dang / yul gyi rnam pa nye bar gyur pa skye la /
translated: They arise as the nature of realization, as the subject that ascertains its specific object and as the object’s aspect.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rtogs pa'i ngo bo kho na skye'i /
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las rtogs pa'i ngo bo kho na skye'i /
translated: Moreover, the nature of realization arises from the similar immediately preceding condition through its forward and reverse pervasion.

original: mig la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges la /
translated: It is ascertained that it does not arise from eyes and so on.

original: de bzhin du yul las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid dbang po las ni yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su nges so //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid dbang po las ni yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su nges so //
translated: Similarly, it is ascertained that from the object it is just like that and from the sense faculty it is the apprehender that ascertains its specific object.

original: de ltar yul las ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin la /🔽mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid @281a * //
analyzed: de ltar yul las ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa ma yin la / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid @281a * //
translated: Thus from the object it is not the nature of realization and so on.

original: la sogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: la sogs pa ma yin /
translated: From the similar immediately preceding condition it is not the nature of the object and so on.

original: dbang po las kyang ma yin pas rgyu'i tha dad pa ni tha dad par byed pa nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las kyang ma yin pas rgyu'i tha dad pa ni tha dad par byed pa nyid kho na yin te /
translated: But since they are not different in terms of their faculties, their difference is due to their being the cause of difference.

original: rgyu tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa dag las khyad par tha dad pa dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that because different causes give rise to different features,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar khyad par gang yin pa de dag gal te brtags pa ma yin pa kho na zhig gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par gang yin pa de dag gal te brtags pa ma yin pa kho na zhig gam /
translated: In this regard, if those features are not just imputed,

original: ldog pa'i bye brag gis brtags pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag gis brtags pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: or if they are just imputed by the specific reversal of the object,

original: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar du ma nyid du thal ba'am /
analyzed: de la gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar du ma nyid du thal ba'am /
translated: then in the first case, since they are not different from the nature of the object, it follows that they are as numerous as the object.

original: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du gcig pa nyid du bzlog tu mi rung la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du gcig pa nyid du bzlog tu mi rung la /
translated: Or, like consciousness, the nature of the object is not suitable to be reversed as one.

original: rnam par shes pa yang rtogs pa'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang rtogs pa'i ngo bo las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And since consciousness is not different from the nature of the object,

original: de dang 'dra bar gzugs las mi skye bar thal ba'am /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzugs las mi skye bar thal ba'am /
translated: Likewise, it would follow that it does not arise from form,

original: 'dra ba nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs las skye bar yang smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs las skye bar yang smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would be said to arise from form because it is not different from what is similar.

original: de'i phyir dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu skye ba dang mi skye ba phan tshun 'gal ba dag ji ltar mi 'gal /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu skye ba dang mi skye ba phan tshun 'gal ba dag ji ltar mi 'gal /
translated: Therefore, how could it be non-contradictory that arising and non-arising, which are mutually contradictory, occur at the same time in one thing?

original: ci ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te khyad par de dag rnam par shes pa las don gzhan pa gyur pa kho na'o zhes rtog na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te khyad par de dag rnam par shes pa las don gzhan pa gyur pa kho na'o zhes rtog na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: But if you imagine that those differences are only different from consciousness because you fear this fault, then at that time consciousness would be without cause,

original: mig la sogs pa gzhan kho na la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzhan kho na la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to only other things such as the eyes.

original: de'i phyir rtag par yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that it is permanent and so on.

original: 'on te rtag pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe yang rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin na ni de'i tshe yang rnam par shes pa rgyu med pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is the position that it is permanent, then at that time consciousness would be without cause.

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid kho na la mig la sogs par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid kho na la mig la sogs par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are only imputed to the self.

original: brtags pa'i bdag nyid la yang 'ga' yang nye bar sbyor ba med pas thams cad rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag nyid la yang 'ga' yang nye bar sbyor ba med pas thams cad rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since nothing is applied to the self that is imputed, it follows that everything is causeless.

original: du ma las du ma skye zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma las du ma skye zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position that many effects arise from many causes is also untenable,

original: mar me la sogs pa gcig las kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu du ma skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa du ma las kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i don gcig skye bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa gcig las kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu du ma skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa du ma las kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i don gcig skye bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many effects such as consciousness, etc. are seen to arise from a single cause such as a lamp, etc. and because it is well known that a single object such as consciousness, etc. arises from many causes such as the eye, etc.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'bras bu thams cad la rgyu du ma zhig gis byed na ni 'bras bu re re yang du ma las skye ba'i @281b phyir de nyid rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'bras bu thams cad la rgyu du ma zhig gis byed na ni 'bras bu re re yang du ma las skye ba'i @281b phyir de nyid rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if many causes produce all effects, then since each effect arises from many, the difference in causes would not make a difference in the effect.

original: nyes pa snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The previous error would apply.

original: 'on te 'bras bu re re kho na la re re kho na zhig nye bar sbyor na ni de'i tshe gcig las gcig kho na skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu re re kho na la re re kho na zhig nye bar sbyor na ni de'i tshe gcig las gcig kho na skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: But if each cause produces only one effect, then it would be admitted that one thing arises from one thing.

original: de las yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod pas /
analyzed: de las yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i nyes pa yod pas /
translated: And then the error mentioned above would ensue.

original: 'di ni phyogs gzhan du smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs gzhan du smras pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a position that we maintain.

original: don dam par gcig las du ma skye zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gcig las du ma skye zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position that ultimately many things arise from one thing is also not tenable,

original: snga ma bzhin du rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as before, the absurd consequence would follow that the difference of causes would not make a difference.🔽Thus, if the eye produces a moment of a similar type by means of a specific nature of its own, then it produces its own consciousness by means of that same specific nature.

original: 'di ltar gal te mig bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang gis rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ji
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mig bdag nyid kyi khyad par gang gis rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa med kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ji
translated: In that case, even though the causes are not different, the effects are different. Therefore, the eye and so on would not be the causes of the visual consciousness and so on.

original: ltar 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag tu rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ltar 'bras bu'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag tu rgyu med pa can du mi 'gyur /
translated: Thus, the effect would not be causeless, whether it is different or not different from the cause.

original: de la gang gis na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba bdag nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang med de /
analyzed: de la gang gis na 'bras bu gzhan skyed par 'gyur ba bdag nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang med de /
translated: Moreover, there is no other difference in the nature of the cause that would generate another effect.

original: dngos po thams cad ni cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are partless.

original: des na rgyu rang gi ngo bo 'phos nas 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na rgyu rang gi ngo bo 'phos nas 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the cause does not transfer its own nature and generate the effect.

original: 'on kyang rgyu'i bdag nyid de la khyad par med pa'i phyir des byas pa'i 'bras bu yang khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu'i bdag nyid de la khyad par med pa'i phyir des byas pa'i 'bras bu yang khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, because there is no difference in the nature of the cause, the effect that it produces would not have any difference.

original: gcig las gcig skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig las gcig skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position that one effect arises from one cause is also not correct.

original: thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it would follow that all things would be blind, deaf, and so on.

original: 'di ltar gal te gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po la sogs pas rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skyed par byed pa de'i tshe rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi rgyun chags par mi byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po la sogs pas rang gi rnam par shes pa nye bar skyed par byed pa de'i tshe rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma gzhan gyi rgyun chags par mi byed na /
translated: Thus, if at the time the eye faculty and so on give rise to their own consciousnesses, they do not cause the continuum of other moments of a similar type,

original: de'i tshe skad cig ma gnyis pa la thams cad long ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig ma gnyis pa la thams cad long ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at the time of the second moment all would be blind and so on.

original: dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position that cause and effect are simultaneous is also untenable.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rgyu yang med pa nyid pas ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba kho nar nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rgyu yang med pa nyid pas ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba kho nar nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because prior to the arising of the effect, the cause does not exist, it is just like the horn of a rabbit. It is not endowed with the capacity.

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi ngo bo nyid thob pa nyid kyis nus pa yin pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang rgyu dang dus mnyam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa kho na nyid yin pas de la des cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir rgyur tha
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi ngo bo nyid thob pa nyid kyis nus pa yin pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu yang rgyu dang dus mnyam par yod pa nyid kyi phyir grub pa kho na nyid yin pas de la des cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir rgyur tha
translated: If it is the case that it is the capacity that obtains its own nature, then because the effect also exists simultaneously with the cause, it is already established. Therefore, because it has nothing to do with it, the cause is not a cause.

original: snyad gdags par rigs pa ma yin te /🔽dper na 'bras bur 'dod @282a * //
analyzed: snyad gdags par rigs pa ma yin te / dper na 'bras bur 'dod @282a * //
translated: It is not reasonable to impute it.

original: pa de nyid rgyu'i dngos po ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa de nyid rgyu'i dngos po ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, that which is asserted as the effect is not the entity of the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par gzhag par ji ltar ma 'chol bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par gzhag par ji ltar ma 'chol bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, how could one understand the unmixed presentation of the entities of cause and effect?

original: dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The position called “different times” is also not tenable.

original: dus tha dad pa nyid yin na yang 'bras bu rgyu bas snga ba'am 'phyi ba zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid yin na yang 'bras bu rgyu bas snga ba'am 'phyi ba zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: If there were difference in time, would the effect arise earlier than the cause or later?

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the case that the effect arises earlier than the cause.

original: de lta na ni ma 'ongs pa kho na las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma 'ongs pa kho na las 'bras bu skye bar 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would be asserted that the effect arises from the future alone.

original: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni med do zhes de ni sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni med do zhes de ni sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: The entity called “future” does not exist, as this has already been analyzed.

original: de ni phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the second position.

original: 'di ltar phyis 'bras bu skye ba na skad cig mas chod pa'am mchod pa zhig tu skye grang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyis 'bras bu skye ba na skad cig mas chod pa'am mchod pa zhig tu skye grang /
translated: Thus, when the effect arises later, does it arise having been interrupted by the present or without being interrupted?

original: gal te chod nas skye na ni de'i tshe 'das pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chod nas skye na ni de'i tshe 'das pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it arises having been interrupted, then it would be accepted that it arises only from the past.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes sngar khong du chud par byas zin to //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes sngar khong du chud par byas zin to //
translated: But that is not logical, as was previously understood.

original: mchod par zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mchod par zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical to say that it is “worshipped.”

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis mchod pa zhig yin grang na /🔽phyogs gcig gis sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis mchod pa zhig yin grang na / phyogs gcig gis sam /
translated: In this way, if the prior and subsequent moments are worshipped,🔽is it worshipped by one part

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur grang /
translated: or by the whole?

original: re zhig phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not by one part,

original: skad cig ma dag las cha shas med pa nyid kyis phyogs gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dag las cha shas med pa nyid kyis phyogs gcig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the prior and subsequent moments are partless because they are momentary.

original: de lta ma yin na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, they would not have the characteristic of being the end of time.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not by the whole,

original: dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they are simultaneous.

original: dus mnyam pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that things that are simultaneous are not related as cause and effect.

original: skad cig ma gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal ba bzhin du bskal pa yang skad cig ma nyid du thal ba bzlog dka' ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal ba bzhin du bskal pa yang skad cig ma nyid du thal ba bzlog dka' ste /
translated: If two moments were to meet in every way, then just as it is difficult to avoid the consequence that an aeon would be an instant, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that an aggregate would be the size of an atom.

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yin na /🔽rdul phra rab thams cad kyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du skad cig ma rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa yin na ni skad cig ma thams cad skad
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yin na / rdul phra rab thams cad kyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du skad cig ma rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod pa yin na ni skad cig ma thams cad skad
translated: If atoms were to join in every way,

original: cig ma gcig kho na'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir skal pa yang skad cig ma tsam nyid du thal bar bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: cig ma gcig kho na'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir skal pa yang skad cig ma tsam nyid du thal bar bzlog dka'o //
translated: then just as it is difficult to avoid the consequence that an aggregate would be the size of an atom because all atoms would enter into one another in every way, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that an aeon would be an instant because all instants would enter into one instant.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag @282b mchod pa yin na yang dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag @282b mchod pa yin na yang dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that cause and effect are simultaneous, they would not be cause and effect.

original: dper na dngos po dang zhig nas med pa dag lta bu dang / dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag mchod pa yin yang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper rjod par byed na /
analyzed: dper na dngos po dang zhig nas med pa dag lta bu dang / dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag mchod pa yin yang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper rjod par byed na /
translated: For example, it is like a thing and its postdisintegration state, or like a shadow and sunlight, which are simultaneous but not in the same place. Cause and effect are also like that.

original: dpe de dag ni kho bo cag la ma grub ste /
analyzed: dpe de dag ni kho bo cag la ma grub ste /
translated: But these examples are not established for us,

original: thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa nyid pas de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa nyid pas de la yang brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are ultimately unarisen, and so the same objections and analyses apply to them.

original: 'di ltar gal te zhig nas med pa dang / dngos por lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni de'i tshe dus mnyam par thal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te zhig nas med pa dang / dngos por lhan cig bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni de'i tshe dus mnyam par thal te /
translated: Thus, if a thing and its postdisintegration state were simultaneous, they would be simultaneous in all ways.

original: de'i phyir gcig la cig car dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la cig car dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a single thing would simultaneously be a thing and a nonthing, which are mutually exclusive.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du bzlog dka'o //
translated: But if it is by one part, then it is hard to avoid the conclusion that it has parts.

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na lhan cig mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug par 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na lhan cig mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug par 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa ci yang med de /
translated: “ Nonexistent” means that there is no real entity whatsoever that would be the basis for the idea of “togetherness,” etc.

original: 'di ni blos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig kho na yin par zad pas dngos po'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo zhes skad cig las phan tshun du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dag gnas pa dgag pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag gi don dam par ni ma
analyzed: 'di ni blos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig kho na yin par zad pas dngos po'i mjug thogs su 'byung ngo zhes skad cig las phan tshun du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dag gnas pa dgag pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag gi don dam par ni ma
translated: This is only the nature imagined by the intellect, and it is said to arise in the wake of a real entity, in order to refute the idea that the nature of a real entity persists from one moment to another.

original: yin no // don dam par ni khyed rgyu'i mjug thogs su 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: yin no // don dam par ni khyed rgyu'i mjug thogs su 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: This is not the ultimate sense, but in the ultimate sense, you accept that the effect arises in the wake of the cause.

original: des na de la mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de la mchod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the idea of “togetherness,” etc., is applicable to that.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni de kho na nyid mtha' gnyi ga dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par na de dngos po yang ma yin la dngos po med par yang ma grub na de ji ltar de gnyis dpe nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni de kho na nyid mtha' gnyi ga dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par na de dngos po yang ma yin la dngos po med par yang ma grub na de ji ltar de gnyis dpe nyid du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: But according to us, since reality is free from the two extremes, ultimately it is neither a thing nor a non-thing. How could these two be established as examples?

original: 'dis ni grib ma dang nyi ma'i dper yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni grib ma dang nyi ma'i dper yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: This also clarifies the example of the sun and shade.

original: 'di ltar grib ma dang nyi ma rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid cha shas can gyi ngo bo dag gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni de'i tshe yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar grib ma dang nyi ma rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid cha shas can gyi ngo bo dag gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis mchod na ni de'i tshe yul gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the sun and shade, which are by nature the accumulation of subtle particles, are by nature partless, then if they were to occupy the same place, it follows that they would be the same.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bas brgal zhing brtag par mtshungs so //🔽rnam par shes pa snang ba'i ngo bo dag yin na yang de gnyis brdzun pa'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa'i @283a * //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bas brgal zhing brtag par mtshungs so // rnam par shes pa snang ba'i ngo bo dag yin na yang de gnyis brdzun pa'i phyir mchod pa la sogs pa'i @283a * //
translated: But if they occupy the same place in part, then it follows that they have parts. So the objection and analysis are similar.

original: bsam pa mi 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam pa mi 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Even if consciousness and appearance were to be by nature the same, since both are false, the thought of worship and so on would not arise.

original: de'i phyir yang dper yang ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dper yang ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the example is not established.

original: srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpe gang yin pa de yang don dam par ma grub ste /🔽'di ltar re zhig srang mda' zhes bya ba cha shas can gyi rdzas gcig pu ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpe gang yin pa de yang don dam par ma grub ste / 'di ltar re zhig srang mda' zhes bya ba cha shas can gyi rdzas gcig pu ni ma grub ste /
translated: The example of the ascending and descending of the scale is not established ultimately.

original: gcig la gyen thur du 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba gnyis dang ldan pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gyen thur du 'gro ba la sogs pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba gnyis dang ldan pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, first, a single substance called a scale is not established because it is not tenable that a single thing has two mutually exclusive actions, such as ascending and descending.

original: du mar dbye na yang rdul phra rab tu dbye grang na /
analyzed: du mar dbye na yang rdul phra rab tu dbye grang na /
translated: If it is analyzed as manifold, then it is analyzed as subtle particles.🔽Those subtle particles are also accepted as having different directional parts, such as east and north, because they are apprehended as abiding.

original: rdul phra rab de dag kyang shar dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad par yongs su 'dzin par gnas par khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs tha dad pa yang khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag kyang shar dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad par yongs su 'dzin par gnas par khas blangs pa'i phyir phyogs tha dad pa yang khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, different directions are also accepted.

original: de lta bu de dag gi don dam par yod par ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bu de dag gi don dam par yod par ma grub po //
translated: Such things are not ultimately established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi s'a lu ldang pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi s'a lu ldang pa la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Sālu Sprout Sūtra, the Bhagavat said:

original: chad par lta ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpe bstan pa gang yin pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i kun rdzob pa la blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: chad par lta ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir srang mda'i mthon dman gyi dpe bstan pa gang yin pa de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i kun rdzob pa la blta bar bya'i /
translated: The example of the scale’s high and low points was taught in order to completely abandon the view of annihilation.

original: don dam pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is to be viewed in terms of the conventional, the cause and effect, and not in terms of the ultimate,

original: de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established in that way.

original: ji ste srang rnam par shes pa snang ba tsam gyi ngo bo nyid du ston na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par na mtho ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi srid pa nyid yin na ji ltar dpe
analyzed: ji ste srang rnam par shes pa snang ba tsam gyi ngo bo nyid du ston na ni de'i tshe rnam par shes pa lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par na mtho ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi srid pa nyid yin na ji ltar dpe
translated: But if you teach that the scale is the nature of mere appearance of consciousness, then at that time, since consciousness is not physical, the ultimate high points and so on are impossible. So how could the example

original: grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: grub par 'gyur /
translated: be established?

original: rnam par shes pa yang don dam par na gnyis su med pa nyid yin pa las gnyis su snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir de snang ba'i srang yang brdzun pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang don dam par na gnyis su med pa nyid yin pa las gnyis su snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir de snang ba'i srang yang brdzun pa kho na yin la /
translated: And since consciousness is ultimately nondual, and the appearance of duality is false, the scale that appears as that is false as well.

original: ji ltar srang don dam par yod par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar srang don dam par yod par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: So how could the scale be ultimately established?

original: de lta bas na ji ltar yang gzhan las skye bar mi 'grub bo //🔽slob dpon rnams kyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob pa grub pa kho na las kun rdzob tu gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las kyang gcig skye ba gzigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa rnams rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bye brag tu 'byed pa nyid du nye bar drangs nas byis pa'i skye
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar yang gzhan las skye bar mi 'grub bo // slob dpon rnams kyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rdzob pa grub pa kho na las kun rdzob tu gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las kyang gcig skye ba gzigs pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa rnams rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bye brag tu 'byed pa nyid du nye bar drangs nas byis pa'i skye
translated: Therefore, arising from other is not established in any way.

original: bo gzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gzhung gzugs par rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du bshad kyi /🔽don dam par ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: bo gzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gzhung gzugs par rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du bshad kyi / don dam par ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The masters have stated that the reason is a result in order to prove to the childish that the eye and so on are the specific causes of visual consciousness and so on, because they see that many results arise from one cause and one result arises from many causes, in terms of the conventional truth of established causes and effects.

original: don dam par de ma grub @283b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de ma grub @283b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is stated in terms of the conventional, not the ultimate, because ultimately they are not established.

original: grangs can la sogs pa gang dag myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu sa dang chu dang sa bon la sogs pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa mthong nas don dam par rang dang gzhan las skye bar rtogs par byed pa de dag gi yang
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa gang dag myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu sa dang chu dang sa bon la sogs pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa mthong nas don dam par rang dang gzhan las skye bar rtogs par byed pa de dag gi yang
translated: The Enumerators and so on see that the causes of such things as sprouts, such as earth, water, seeds, and so on, are neither different nor nondifferent and they think that ultimately things arise from self and other.

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs la bshad pa'i nyes pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir rtog pa 'di yang bzang po ma yin no //🔽gang dag ri mo mkhan la sogs pa'i byed pa med par rma bya la sogs pa'i sgro bkra ba nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid du rjod par byed pa de dag gi phyogs kyang dngos po rnams res 'ga'
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs la bshad pa'i nyes pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir rtog pa 'di yang bzang po ma yin no // gang dag ri mo mkhan la sogs pa'i byed pa med par rma bya la sogs pa'i sgro bkra ba nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid du rjod par byed pa de dag gi phyogs kyang dngos po rnams res 'ga'
translated: But because the faults explained in the context of both of those positions apply to them, their conception is not good.🔽Those who say that all things are without causes because they see that the variegatedness of such things as peacocks and so on are not the effects of such things as the actions of painters and so on, their position is illogical because things are sometimes seen

original: bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa rgyu khyad par can la ltos pa mthong ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa rgyu khyad par can la ltos pa mthong ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and because they are seen to depend on such things as special causes such as place, time, and substance.

original: ltos pa med pa las ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa las ni res 'ga' ba nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that something that is not dependent on another would be intermittent,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i dus gnyis khyad par med pa'i phyir rtag tu dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i dus gnyis khyad par med pa'i phyir rtag tu dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: because there would be no difference between the two times of existence and nonexistence of a thing. It would either always exist or

original: dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would always be nonexistent.

original: rma bya la sogs pa'i dpe gang yin pa de yang dngos po rnams rgyu med par skye ba don dam par bsgrub par bya ba las ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa'i dpe gang yin pa de yang dngos po rnams rgyu med par skye ba don dam par bsgrub par bya ba las ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The examples of the peacock and so on are not established in regard to the proof of the ultimate production of things without a cause.

original: don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are unproduced.

original: bsgrub par bya ba kun rdzob pa yin na ni dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba kun rdzob pa yin na ni dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba yin te /
translated: If the probandum is conventional, then the example is incomplete as a proof.

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa'i khyad par gang la ltos nas dpe de dag grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa'i khyad par gang la ltos nas dpe de dag grub pa nyid de /
translated: Because the examples are established in dependence on the distinctions of place, time, substance, and so on.

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang ba nyid do //
translated: Since they are the cause of those, the example is incomplete as a proof.

original: de bas na de la ri mo mkhan gyi bya ba la sogs pa med dod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na de la ri mo mkhan gyi bya ba la sogs pa med dod kyi /
translated: Therefore, in that case, there is no activity of the painter and so on.

original: 'on kyang de dag rgyu med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag rgyu med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not without a cause,

original: de dag rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from their own causes.

original: dngos po'i nus pa rnams so sor nges pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa rnams so sor nges pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And since the potencies of things are restricted, not everything arises from everything.

original: me dang du ba la sogs pa yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yod la /
analyzed: me dang du ba la sogs pa yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yod la /
translated: And since fire and smoke, etc. are established as cause and effect by perception and non-apprehension, the thesis is contradicted by perception.

original: dngos po rnams res 'ga' ba nyid kyis ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yod do //🔽gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la rang gi @284a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams res 'ga' ba nyid kyis ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yod do // gtan tshigs las bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la rang gi @284a * //
translated: And since things are established as having dependence because of their occasional nature, the thesis is contradicted by inference.

original: tshig dang 'gal ba yang yod do //
analyzed: tshig dang 'gal ba yang yod do //
translated: And since it is admitted that certainty about the probandum arises from the reason, the thesis is contradicted by one’s own words.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the employment of the reason would be pointless.

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The desired object is not accomplished merely by a promise,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would be accomplished.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: ci ste khyod la bzhi po bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na de yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste khyod la bzhi po bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na de yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the reason is unestablished because the subject, which is to be established for you, is unestablished, that is not correct.

original: grub pa'i mtha' la rten pa'i chos can gyi khyad par nya bar bzung nas bsgrub pa rjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la rten pa'i chos can gyi khyad par nya bar bzung nas bsgrub pa rjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The subject is not stated in terms of a specific subject based on a philosophical tenet,

original: chos can de lta bu rgol ba gnyi ga la ni gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can de lta bu rgol ba gnyi ga la ni gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such a subject is not established for either of the two parties in any context.

original: grub na ni grub par bya ba yang grub pa nyid pas rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub na ni grub par bya ba yang grub pa nyid pas rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established, then since it would be established, there would be no dispute.

original: 'on kyang gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa'i dngos po dag la rab tu smra ba thams cad kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa'i bsam pa'i 'jug pa nyid pas kho bo cag la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa'i dngos po dag la rab tu smra ba thams cad kyi bsgrub par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa'i bsam pa'i 'jug pa nyid pas kho bo cag la nyes pa med do //
translated: However, since the existence of things that are known to everyone, including cowherds, is the basis for the thought processes of all speakers, who employ them in their assertions, we are not at fault.

original: kho bo cag gis ni sgrub pa 'di gang gis na 'di'i chos can dngos por gyur pa btsal bar gyur pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bor bshad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni sgrub pa 'di gang gis na 'di'i chos can dngos por gyur pa btsal bar gyur pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bor bshad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: We do not say that the proof is the object of the probandum, which is the existent subject of the proof.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: dgag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: We say that the proof is the negation.

original: de yang dngos po med pa la legs par rab tu grub pas ji ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa la legs par rab tu grub pas ji ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: And since that is well established in the case of nonexistents, how can the reason be unestablished?

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate.

original: sngar rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad bsal bas de yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rtag pa'i dngos po thams cad bsal bas de yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all permanent things have been refuted earlier, they are excluded.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i gang zag gis ma nges pa nyid dag kyang ma yin te ;
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i gang zag gis ma nges pa nyid dag kyang ma yin te ;
translated: Nor is it indeterminate in the sense of the inexpressible person, who is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: dngos por yod pa la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por yod pa la brjod par bya ba ma yin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for something that exists as a real entity to be inexpressible.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni gcig la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni cig shos bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir cig shos dgag pa gang yin pa dngos po gzhan sgrub pa yin na ji ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni gcig la bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni cig shos bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir cig shos dgag pa gang yin pa dngos po gzhan sgrub pa yin na ji ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba dngos por 'gyur /
translated: Thus, permanence and impermanence are characteristics that are mutually exclusive and one is established by the negation of the other. If the negation of one is not the establishment of the other, then how could the inexpressible become a real entity?

original: de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no distinction, all real entities would be inexpressible.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gang dag dngos po @284b rnams rkyen dag las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po @284b rnams rkyen dag las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Some say: Things are not produced from conditions.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: gsal ba kho nas te /
analyzed: gsal ba kho nas te /
translated: They are only manifested.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na'o snyam du sems pa de yang snying po ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na'o snyam du sems pa de yang snying po ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the reason is only indefinite.

original: dngos po rtag pa thams cad gsal ba nyid kyi phyir gsal bar bya ba rtag pa ci yang med pas gsal ba yang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa thams cad gsal ba nyid kyi phyir gsal bar bya ba rtag pa ci yang med pas gsal ba yang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not the case, because all things are permanent and manifest. Since there is nothing permanent that is manifest, manifestation is also manifest.

original: gzhan yang rkyen rnams kyi dngos po gsal ba zhig yin na /🔽ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang rkyen rnams kyi dngos po gsal ba zhig yin na / ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Moreover, if the thing of conditions is manifest,🔽why does its intrinsic identity expand?

original: de'i sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: Or is it the nature of the complete exhaustion of its obscurations?

original: dbang po legs par sbyangs pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po legs par sbyangs pa'am /
translated: Or is it the refinement of the faculties?

original: yul de la shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gcig yin grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
analyzed: yul de la shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gcig yin grang zhes rnam par brtag ste /
translated: Or is it the single characteristic of the arising of consciousness in that object?

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the first position is not tenable,

original: rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that permanence would be undermined.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo ma rgyas pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin la gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen gyis sngon med pa'i rang gi ngo bo rgyas pa zhig skye na ni de'i tshe de las rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo ma rgyas pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin la gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen gyis sngon med pa'i rang gi ngo bo rgyas pa zhig skye na ni de'i tshe de las rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-expansion of its own nature is the intrinsic termination of that, and if the condition that causes its manifestation generates a new nature that did not previously exist, then at that time, its intrinsic identity would expand.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that.

original: rang gi ngo bo snga ma 'gag par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di la rgyas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang gi ngo bo gnyis 'chol bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo snga ma 'gag par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di la rgyas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang gi ngo bo gnyis 'chol bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the previous nature does not cease, then at that time, you would be accepting that expansion and the intrinsic nature that is the opposite of expansion are mixed.

original: rang gi ngo bo sngon med pa zhig mi skye na ni gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sngon med pa zhig mi skye na ni gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a previous nature does not generate a new nature, then the condition that causes manifestation would be pointless.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang sngar rgyas par gsal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang sngar rgyas par gsal ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The arising of things is also illogical, as was previously explained in detail.

original: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the complete termination of obscuration.

original: med pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis gang gis kyang bya bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po med pa nyid kyis gang gis kyang bya bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of non-existence cannot possibly be an object of any action, due to its being non-existent.

original: bya ba dngos po'i ngo bo yang sngar gsal zin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'ga' zhig gis rtag pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin khyad par can 'ga' zhig ma bshig pa'am /
analyzed: bya ba dngos po'i ngo bo yang sngar gsal zin pa'i phyir ro // 'ga' zhig gis rtag pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin khyad par can 'ga' zhig ma bshig pa'am /
translated: And the nature of an object of action has already been clarified above.

original: ma bskyed par ni nam yang sgrib pa med par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bskyed par ni nam yang sgrib pa med par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is never reasonable for anyone to make something non-obstructive without destroying or producing some special nature of an existent thing.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurdity.

original: yul de la shes pa skye ba'i gegs byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul de la shes pa skye ba'i gegs byed pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that it obstructs by acting as an impediment to the arising of consciousness with respect to that object.

original: de rang gi lus la shes pa skyed par nus pa'am /
analyzed: de rang gi lus la shes pa skyed par nus pa'am /
translated: Because it is capable of producing consciousness with respect to its own body,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / shes pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la sus kyang bgegs bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / shes pa rgyu ma tshang ba med pa la sus kyang bgegs bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because its consciousness is of the nature of consciousness, and no one can impede a consciousness for which the causes are complete.

original: ci ste 'di @285a * //
analyzed: ci ste 'di @285a * //
translated: If it is said that it is not an object of consciousness,🔽then it is not tenable that it is an object of consciousness.

original: mi nus pa'ang de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang bas yul de la rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'di ni yul de la shes pa skye ba'i gegs byed
analyzed: mi nus pa'ang de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de'i tshe bdag nyid kyis rgyu ma tshang bas yul de la rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'di ni yul de la shes pa skye ba'i gegs byed
translated: If the object is not the nature of what is cognized by its consciousness, then at that time, because its cause is incomplete, consciousness does not arise with respect to that object. Therefore it is not logical that this is an obstruction that prevents consciousness from arising with respect to that object.

original: pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid kyis sgrib par byed pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the nature of what is not an obstruction is to prevent the arising of consciousness.

original: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i bgegs med pa dang ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang bya bar rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa yang dag par zad pa bzhin du shes pa skye ba'i bgegs med pa dang ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang bya bar rigs pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not logical that the nature of what is not an obstruction is to prevent the arising of consciousness, just like the complete exhaustion of an obstruction.

original: de bas na mi nus pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de bas na mi nus pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, because it is not possible,

original: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de la sgrib par byed la bzlog kyang yul de la rnam par shes pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
