analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis de la sgrib par byed la bzlog kyang yul de la rnam par shes pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: or because it is not the nature of what is cognized by its consciousness, it is not logical that the conditions that illuminate it are obstructions, and that consciousness arises with respect to that object even when it is reversed.

original: 'on te nus par khas len na ni de'i tshe sgrib par byed pa yod du zin kyang de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur bas gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis byed pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te nus par khas len na ni de'i tshe sgrib par byed pa yod du zin kyang de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rtag tu skye bar 'gyur bas gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis byed pa don med pa yin no //
translated: But if you accept that they have the ability, then even when there is an obstruction, consciousness would always arise because its causes are complete. Therefore, it is pointless for the illuminating factors to function.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa rnams la chung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'ga' yang sgrib par byed pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa rnams la chung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'ga' yang sgrib par byed pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because they do not perform the slightest function in relation to permanent entities, it is illogical that they are obstructions.

original: mi rtag pa rnams la ni rnam par shes pa skyed mi nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa nyid kyis rgyu'i khyad par kho na res 'ga' zhig sgrib par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no ;

translated: But in relation to impermanent entities, the difference in the causes that give rise to consciousness is itself the obstruction in some cases, because they give rise to other moments that are incapable of producing consciousness.

analyzed: legs par bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa zhig byed na ni de legs par byed par rigs pa ma yin te ;

analyzed: de la cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

translated: But if the potential is of the nature of that consciousness, then at that time, like its own nature, consciousness would always be near because its causes are not incomplete.🔽Therefore, the manifestors

original: kyis don dam par skye ba la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: kyis don dam par skye ba la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Because that which reifies ultimate production, etc. is undermined by validating cognition, it is an imaginary nature.

original: sngar ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad du bshad pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: de lta ma yin na ni phyi rol gyi don yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi bzung /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni phyi rol gyi don yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi bzung /
translated: If it were not so, then external objects would also be apprehended as ultimately existent, because they are empty of imaginary natures.

original: ci ste tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid du mi gzung na ni gal te de lta na skye ba la sogs pa yang tshad mas @287b gnod pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa nyid du mi gzung na ni gal te de lta na skye ba la sogs pa yang tshad mas @287b gnod pa'i phyir de bzhin du gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if you do not apprehend them as ultimately existent because they are undermined by validating cognition, then in the same way, production, etc. should not be apprehended, because they are undermined by validating cognition.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa grags pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mas gnod par bya ba mi nus so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa grags pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mas gnod par bya ba mi nus so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that production, etc. cannot be undermined by validating cognition because they are well known, that is not so.

original: don dam par ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not ultimately,

original: kun rdzob tu grags pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar spyad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu grags pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar spyad pa bzhin no //
translated: but just as it was previously, because they are well known conventionally.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /🔽dngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / dngos rnams skye ba kun rdzob tu ;
translated: The Lord also said:🔽The arising of things is in the conventional sense,

original: / dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
analyzed: / dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
translated: but in the ultimate sense they are natureless.

original: rang bzhin med la 'khrul pa gang //🔽de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
analyzed: rang bzhin med la 'khrul pa gang // de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
translated: That which is mistaken as to naturelessness

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: is said to be a concealer of reality.

original: de lta ma yin na phyi rol gyi don yang grags pa'i tshad mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phyi rol gyi don yang grags pa'i tshad mas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then even external objects would not be undermined by the valid cognitions of everyday world.

original: de lta bas na tshad mas grags pa'i grags pa gang yin pas de kho na rigs pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad mas grags pa'i grags pa gang yin pas de kho na rigs pa yin gyi ;
translated: Therefore, that which is the reality of things is that which is known by the valid cognitions of everyday world,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: and not anything else.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus, the Lord, in the noble Sandhinirmocana and so on,

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ni ngas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum las dgongs nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de dang yang mi 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ni ngas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum las dgongs nas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de dang yang mi 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: did not contradict the teaching that the three natures are the three naturelessnesses of all things.

original: 'dir yang ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, there is no contradiction in positing the three natures.

original: 'di ltar ma brtags par grags pa dngos po rnams kyi byed cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma brtags par grags pa dngos po rnams kyi byed cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Thus, the nature of things that is renowned without analysis, and is the dependent nature,

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du rkyen gyi dbang gis skye bas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du rkyen gyi dbang gis skye bas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: is the nature of dependent arising. Since it arises in dependence on conditions, like an illusion, it is ultimately natureless, and thus the nature of production is natureless.

original: de la don dam par skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de la don dam par skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The nature that is imputed in the ultimate, such as production, is the imagined nature.

original: de yang tshad mas ji ltar rnam par brtags pa bzhin ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshad mas ji ltar rnam par brtags pa bzhin ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not established as a nature in accordance with how it is imagined by valid knowledge, it is the naturelessness of character.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la ji skad bshad pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la ji skad bshad pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The consummate entity is the emptiness of the dependent entity of the imagined entity as it has been explained.

original: de ni tshad mas yang dag par grub pa nyid du rtag tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshad mas yang dag par grub pa nyid du rtag tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always established as being truly established by a valid cognition.

original: de yang chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas 'dir yang thams cad mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas 'dir yang thams cad mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is the ultimate naturelessness because it is the general characteristic that pervades all phenomena, there is no contradiction at all here.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gdul bya la khyad par lta ba yongs su spang pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las @288a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gdul bya la khyad par lta ba yongs su spang pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las @288a * //
translated: In order to abandon the view that is attached to arising, ceasing, and so on, the Bhagavat in the noble Unraveling the Intention and so on

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid du brtan pa gang yin pa de yang don dam par ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod pa nyid du brtan pa gang yin pa de yang don dam par ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: affirmed the existence of consciousness and so on, but that should be taken as not being ultimately.

original: 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together says,

original: ji skad du rigs kyi bu 'jig rten gnas pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du rigs kyi bu 'jig rten gnas pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: “Son of noble family, the world is attached to arising and ceasing.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po can gyis 'jig rten gyi skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba 'gag go zhes gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po can gyis 'jig rten gyi skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir tha snyad kyi dbang gis skye ba 'gag go zhes gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata, the one with great compassion, says that arising and ceasing are due to the power of social convention, in order to eliminate the world’s fear of emptiness.

original: 'di la chos 'ga' yang skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la chos 'ga' yang skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: But in reality, there is no arising of any dharma at all.”

original: de lta bas na lung las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na lung las kyang /
translated: Therefore, even from scripture,

original: chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: it is established that ultimately all things are essenceless.

original: des na dngos po dag la don dam par skye ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: des na dngos po dag la don dam par skye ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa ni phyin ci log yin la /
translated: Therefore, the conception that things ultimately arise and so forth is a mistake.

original: de las bzlog pa mngon par ma zhen pa ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa mngon par ma zhen pa ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gnas so //
translated: The opposite of that is called “nonmistaken.”

original: thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung ba'i dngos po mngon par zhen pa'i gdon gyis brlams pa kha cig gis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad du /🔽gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i srid par 'byung ba'i dngos po mngon par zhen pa'i gdon gyis brlams pa kha cig gis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad du / gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
translated: They say:🔽When it is destroyed or analyzed

original: btsal na de'i blo mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: btsal na de'i blo mi 'byung ba //
translated: by the mind, the conception of it does not occur,

original: bum chu sogs bzhin kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: bum chu sogs bzhin kun rdzob tu //
translated: like a pot or water, it exists conventionally,

original: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
analyzed: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //
translated: but ultimate existence is different from that.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de phyin ci ma log par ston par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de phyin ci ma log par ston par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But this cannot be taught unerringly.🔽For example, some say that in order to prove that pots and so on are conventional realities, they are established as conventional realities by the imputation of wholes such as pots by others.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can nyid du kun brtags pa rnams kun rdzob pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa gal te bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag don dam par yod na ci'i phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis bum pa la sogs pa yan lag can nyid du kun brtags pa rnams kun rdzob pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa gal te bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag don dam par yod na ci'i phyir
translated: If pots and so on exist ultimately, why🔽does the conception of it not occur when it is destroyed?

original: de dag bcom na de'i blo mi 'byung zhes bya ba de ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag bcom na de'i blo mi 'byung zhes bya ba de ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: This is not certain.

original: 'di ltar bcag na zhes bya ba zhig na zhes bya ba'i don yin par brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe de nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de dag la de lta bu'i blo mi 'byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcag na zhes bya ba zhig na zhes bya ba'i don yin par brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe de nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de dag la de lta bu'i blo mi 'byung bar zad kyi /
translated: But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,

original: brdzun pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang srid do //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang srid do //
translated: but it is not because of being false.🔽But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.🔽But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.

original: 'on te cha shas su bshig na zhes bya ba'i don yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag ldan pa zhig yin pa dang / yan lag can zhig yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i blo mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dogs so //
analyzed: 'on te cha shas su bshig na zhes bya ba'i don yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag ldan pa zhig yin pa dang / yan lag can zhig yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i blo mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dogs so //
translated: But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.

original: blos gzhan bstsal na zhes pa de yang ha cang khyab ches pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid de /🔽ji ste bum pa la sogs pa blos rnam par gzhigs na /
analyzed: blos gzhan bstsal na zhes pa de yang ha cang khyab ches pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid de /🔽ji ste bum pa la sogs pa blos rnam par gzhigs na /
translated: But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.🔽But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.🔽But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.🔽But if the meaning of “if it were broken” is “if it were destroyed,” then it is just that, and therefore it is only because of that that such a conception does not occur,🔽but it is not because of being false.

original: cha shas kyis ngo bo nyid don @288b dam pa pa nges pa mi zin pa ltar rdul phra rab dag dang rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bas de dag kyang kun rdzob nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas kyis ngo bo nyid don @288b dam pa pa nges pa mi zin pa ltar rdul phra rab dag dang rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bas de dag kyang kun rdzob nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the ultimate nature of a thing is not ascertained by its parts, so it is with the subtle particles and consciousness. Therefore, it follows that they are also just conventional.

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams lus can yin pa'i gdon mi za bar phyogs cha tha dad par khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams lus can yin pa'i gdon mi za bar phyogs cha tha dad par khas blang dgos so //
translated: Since the subtle particles are necessarily embodied, they must be accepted as having different directional parts.

original: de lta ma yin na shar dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad par gnas med pa'i phyir ri la sogs bsags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shar dang byang la sogs pa'i phyogs cha tha dad par gnas med pa'i phyir ri la sogs bsags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since they would not be situated in different directional parts, such as east and north, they would not accumulate to form mountains and so on.

original: de lta bas na bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir phyogs cha tha dad pas tha dad pa 'di dag cha shas bsal ba byas na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid nges par mi zin pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir phyogs cha tha dad pas tha dad pa 'di dag cha shas bsal ba byas na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid nges par mi zin pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they are the nature of an accumulation, these particles, which are different due to having different directional parts, are just conventional, since their nature is not ascertained when their parts are removed, like a pot and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa yang gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang gdon mi za bar rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs dgos te /
translated: And consciousness must be admitted to have aspects,

original: shes pa ni thams cad du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir rnam pa med pa yin yang yul 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa so sor nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni thams cad du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir rnam pa med pa yin yang yul 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa so sor nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness, although it is without aspects, is not suitable to be posited as the apprehender of objects, because it is the same in all cases in being the nature of cognition.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don bzhin du shes pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa re re nas brtsal yang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang mi zin pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don bzhin du shes pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa re re nas brtsal yang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang mi zin pa'i phyir kun rdzob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like external objects, it is the nature of various consciousnesses, and so, although it is sought in each of the various aspects, it is not apprehended as any nature at all, and so it is conventional.

original: de lta na ni kun rdzob pa'i mtshan nyid 'dis dngos po thams cad gsal ba kho nar kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi lta ba kho na gzhung btsugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni kun rdzob pa'i mtshan nyid 'dis dngos po thams cad gsal ba kho nar kun rdzob kyi ngo bor bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi lta ba kho na gzhung btsugs par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, since this characteristic of the conventional clearly establishes all things as only conventional natures, our view alone is well founded.

original: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las //
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las //
translated: In that way, the noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra says:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs rnams kyi //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs rnams kyi //
translated: The nature of those things

original: ngo bo nyid ni nges mi zin //🔽de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni nges par bstan //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni nges mi zin // de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid ni nges par bstan //
translated: that are analyzed by the mind is not ascertained.🔽Therefore, they are said to be inexpressible,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and their nature is ascertained.

original: gzhan dag na re don bya ba byed nus pa'i don de ni don dam par yod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don bya ba byed nus pa'i don de ni don dam par yod kyi /
translated: Others say that the meaning of ultimate existence is the ability to perform a function.

original: gzhan du ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: Other than that, it is conventional existence.

original: de 'dir gal te yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas byis pa rnams gzung ba'i don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod na ni de'i tshe 'di rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dir gal te yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas byis pa rnams gzung ba'i don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod na ni de'i tshe 'di rigs pa yin no //
translated: If, in dependence on the correct conventional, fools express the characteristic of ultimate existence of an apprehended object, then at that time it is reasonable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de las ji lta ba de ltar yod du zad mod ces bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de las ji lta ba de ltar yod du zad mod ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that “it exists just as it appears.”

original: 'on te gcig kho nar don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig kho nar don dam par yod pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the characteristic of ultimate existence in only one way,

original: de'i tshe don dam par dngos po thams cad kyi don bya ba byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe don dam par dngos po thams cad kyi don bya ba byed pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar sngar dpyad pa bzhin no //
translated: then at that time, because the performance of a function by all things ultimately is not established, it is as previously analyzed.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi srid pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi srid pa can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic is impossible.

original: gzhan dag na re shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin no //
translated: Others say: Thatness is the emptiness of consciousness of the aspect of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: gnyis po ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gnyis po ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: The two are conventional truths.

original: 'di ltar gal te med pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid brjod par 'dod na ni de med pa ni de kho na nyid yin no //🔽'on te ma yin @289a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te med pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid brjod par 'dod na ni de med pa ni de kho na nyid yin no // 'on te ma yin @289a * //
translated: Thus, if the nonexistence of an entity is asserted to be emptiness, then that nonexistence is thatness.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe gnyis su snang ba las ma gtogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni de kho na nyid ston par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe gnyis su snang ba las ma gtogs pa shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni de kho na nyid ston par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the nature of nonexistence, then at that time, since the nature of consciousness is not established by valid knowledge apart from the appearance of duality, it is not able to teach thatness.

original: ci ste gal te rnam par shes pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gal te rnam par shes pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But if you think, “If consciousness does not ultimately exist with the characteristic of nonduality,

original: de'i tshe gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu ci zhig yin par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu ci zhig yin par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: then at that time, what is the cause of the appearance of duality?”

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: de dang der lhan cig 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang der lhan cig 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation of that to that is not established.

original: gnyis dang gnyis su med pa ni lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa yang med de /
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis su med pa ni lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa yang med de /
translated: Nor is there a relation of non-duality, because there is no relation of identity with that.

original: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because truth and untruth are mutually exclusive, because of the characteristic of their mutual exclusion.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a relation of origination from that,

original: bden pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang 'byung bar mi srid pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang 'byung bar mi srid pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: because it is impossible for anything to originate from untruth, like the horn of an ass.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Otherwise, it would be only the nature of the other-dependent,

original: kun brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not the imagined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa med na ri bong gi rva bzhin te snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa med na ri bong gi rva bzhin te snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, if there is no relation with consciousness, like the horn of an ass, it does not appear.

original: gzhan yang gal te gnyis po ma gtogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan zhig yin gyi gnyis po ni ma yin pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis po bdag nyid snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gnyis po ma gtogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan zhig yin gyi gnyis po ni ma yin pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis po bdag nyid snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of consciousness is something other than the two, and it is not the two, then at that time the two would not appear to itself.

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang gi ngo bo ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: The nature of consciousness is precisely this:

original: gang bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos la /
analyzed: gang bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos la /
translated: In order to illuminate itself, it does not rely on another illuminator.

original: gsal bar ma byas par yang mi 'dug ste /
analyzed: gsal bar ma byas par yang mi 'dug ste /
translated: And it does not remain without illuminating.

original: nam mkha'i ngos dang mar me'i snying po'i 'od bzhin no //🔽gnyis po yang de dang 'dra bas 'di shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngos dang mar me'i snying po'i 'od bzhin no // gnyis po yang de dang 'dra bas 'di shes pa'i ngo bo ma yin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is like the light of the surface of the sky and the flame of a lamp.🔽Since the two are also like that, it is not reasonable that it is not the nature of consciousness.

original: gnyis po shes pa'i ngo bor gyur pa de yang brdzun pa yin na ni shes pa nyid brdzun pa yin no zhes gsal rab tu smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis po shes pa'i ngo bor gyur pa de yang brdzun pa yin na ni shes pa nyid brdzun pa yin no zhes gsal rab tu smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the two is false, then it is clearly stated that consciousness itself is false.

original: gzhan yang shes pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo bden zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang re zhig rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo bden zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang re zhig rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is called the “real nature of nondual consciousness” is not tenable as permanent.

original: sngar rtag pa'i dngos po rgyas par bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rtag pa'i dngos po rgyas par bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of permanence has already been extensively refuted.

original: rtag pa ni khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor goms pa la sogs pas cung zad kyang mi byed las thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni khyad par du byar med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor goms pa la sogs pas cung zad kyang mi byed las thar pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the permanent cannot be distinguished, it does not perform any function at all through the cultivation of yoga, and so forth. Therefore the effort of those who strive for liberation would be pointless.

original: don dam par ni mi rtag par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni mi rtag par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is also not tenable that it is impermanent.

original: de rgyu dang bcas pa dang rgyu med par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de rgyu dang bcas pa dang rgyu med par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is because arising with a cause or arising without a cause has been refuted.

original: ma skyes par ni mi rtag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ma skyes par ni mi rtag pa yin par rigs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: And it is not tenable that what has not arisen is impermanent.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan yang yod @289b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan yang yod @289b pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the nature of things does not exist.

original: des na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang tshad mas grub pa'i phyir don dam par rigs so //
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang tshad mas grub pa'i phyir don dam par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since the absence of intrinsic reality pervades all things, and since it is established by valid cognition, it is the ultimate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the Bhagavān said:

original: chos kun rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: chos kun rtag tu ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
translated: All phenomena are always empty of intrinsic reality.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'byed //
translated: The sons of the victors distinguish things.

original: srid pa thams cad rnam pa kun tu stong //🔽nyi tshe stong pa mu stegs can rnams kyi //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad rnam pa kun tu stong // nyi tshe stong pa mu stegs can rnams kyi //
translated: All of existence is empty in every way.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The non-Buddhists have a partial emptiness.

original: de lta na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar 'dod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i lam 'di kho na bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar 'dod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'i lam 'di kho na bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Thus, those who wish to abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience should cultivate this very path of the absence of intrinsic reality of all phenomena,

original: sgrib pa'i rtsa ba ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i rtsa ba ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the root of the obstructions is error.

original: phyin ci log thams cad dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa can chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la goms pa 'dis kyang dngos po la sogs pa phyin ci log spong bas rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa can chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la goms pa 'dis kyang dngos po la sogs pa phyin ci log spong bas rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir sgrib pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And by this cultivation of the non-self-existence of all things, which is the antidote to all errors, all obscurations are removed, because the errors of substantiality, etc. are removed by the cutting off of their root.

original: de skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
translated: And so it is said in the Noble Teaching of the Two Truths:

original: 'jam dpal ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yongs su shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ji ltar na nyon mongs pa yongs su shes par 'gyur /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, how is the thorough knowledge of the addictions?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: don dam pa shin tu ma skyes shing ma byung ba'i dngos po dag la kun rdzob tu yod pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log de yod de ma yin pa las phyin ci log pa de las kun du rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo
analyzed: don dam pa shin tu ma skyes shing ma byung ba'i dngos po dag la kun rdzob tu yod pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log de yod de ma yin pa las phyin ci log pa de las kun du rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo
translated: “The error of the non-existent, i.e., the non-existence of the ultimate, which is not born and does not occur, is the error of the relative. From that error, imagination and discrimination arise.

original: // kun du rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: // kun du rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa de las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that imagination and discrimination, the incorrect mental activity arises.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ngo //🔽bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa las lta ba kun nas ldang ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa de las bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa 'byung ngo // bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa las lta ba kun nas ldang ngo //
translated: From that incorrect mental activity, the superimposition of a self arises.🔽From the superimposition of a self, the afflictions arise.

original: lta ba kun nas ldang ba de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lta ba kun nas ldang ba de las nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: From the afflictions, actions arise.🔽From actions, birth arises.🔽From birth, old age, death, and so on arise.🔽Divine son, those who see all phenomena as ultimately unborn and non-arisen see reality.

original: lha'i bu gang dag gis chos thams cad don dam par shin tu ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba'i dngos por mthong ba de ni don dam par phyin ci ma log pa yin no//
analyzed: lha'i bu gang dag gis chos thams cad don dam par shin tu ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba'i dngos por mthong ba de ni don dam par phyin ci ma log pa yin no//
translated: Those who see reality are not mistaken.

original: gang zhig gis don dam par phyin ci ma log pa de ni kun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: gang zhig gis don dam par phyin ci ma log pa de ni kun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: Those who are not mistaken do not conceptualize or discriminate.

original: gang kun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang kun du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa de ni tshul bzhin du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not conceptualize or discriminate are correctly engaged.

original: gang tshul bzhin du zhugs pa de ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang tshul bzhin du zhugs pa de ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are correctly engaged do not superimpose a self.

original: gang bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur ba de la ni lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi 'gyur ba de la ni lta ba kun nas ldang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who do not superimpose a self do not have the afflictions arise.

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das par lta ba kun nas ldang ba'i bar du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das par lta ba kun nas ldang ba'i bar du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and up to the arising of the view of nirvāṇa as ultimate will not arise.

original: skye ba med pa la gnas pa'i de nyid kyi nyon mongs pa shin tu rnam par gdul bar lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la gnas pa'i de nyid kyi nyon mongs pa shin tu rnam par gdul bar lta ste /
translated: “Moreover, Devaputra, the bodhisattva who is skilled in the suchness of non-arising completely subdues the afflictions.

original: 'di nyon mongs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyon mongs pa 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the subduing of the afflictions.

original: lha'i bu gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa dang snang ba med par shes pas don dam par shin tu stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / @290a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa dang snang ba med par shes pas don dam par shin tu stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / @290a * //
translated: “Devaputra, when, through the knowledge of the non-existence of afflictions and appearances, one knows the ultimate to be utterly empty, signless,

original: shin tu dngos po med par rab tu shes pa de'i tshe lha'i bu nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu dngos po med par rab tu shes pa de'i tshe lha'i bu nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: and utterly non-existent, then, Devaputra, the afflictions are thoroughly known.

original: lha'i bu 'di lta ste dper na gang sbrul gyi rigs 'don pa des ni sbrul de'i dug zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu 'di lta ste dper na gang sbrul gyi rigs 'don pa des ni sbrul de'i dug zhi bar byed do //
translated: “Devaputra, it is like this: for example, one who recites the family mantra of a snake can pacify the poison of that snake.

original: lha'i bu de bzhin du gang zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs 'don pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu de bzhin du gang zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs 'don pa de'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Devaputra, in the same way, one who recites the family mantra of the afflictions can pacify the afflictions.

original: lha'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus smras pa /
translated: ” The Devaputra said:🔽“Noble son, what is the family mantra of the afflictions?

original: 'jam dpal nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin /
analyzed: 'jam dpal nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the class of the afflictions?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu chos thams cad kyi dngos po shin tu ma skyes shing ma byung ba dag la kun du rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: lha'i bu chos thams cad kyi dngos po shin tu ma skyes shing ma byung ba dag la kun du rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Divine son, the class of the afflictions is the conception of all things that are not produced and do not arise.

original: dngos po la sogs pas phyin ci log pas kyang phyin ci log thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir spangs na phyin ci log thams cad spangs pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang 'dis legs par spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po la sogs pas phyin ci log pas kyang phyin ci log thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir spangs na phyin ci log thams cad spangs pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang 'dis legs par spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the errors of entity and so on pervade all errors, when they are eliminated, all errors are eliminated. Therefore this also properly eliminates the obscurations to omniscience.

original: sgrib pa ni phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the obscurations are characterized by error.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs na gags byed pa med pa'i phyir sprin la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du thams cad thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'i snang ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs na gags byed pa med pa'i phyir sprin la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du thams cad thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'i snang ba 'jug ste /
translated: When the obscurations to omniscience are eliminated, the light of the knowledge that is unimpeded with respect to everything will shine, like the sun’s rays in a sky free from obscurations such as clouds.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal ba'i ngo bo yin la de yang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal ba'i ngo bo yin la de yang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, consciousness is the nature of the manifestation of the nature of things, and it is close to them.

original: gags byed pa yod na ni dngos po gsal bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gags byed pa yod na ni dngos po gsal bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were an obstruction, the thing would not manifest,

original: gags byed pa med pa yin na go mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa'i phyir ci'i phyir dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gags byed pa med pa yin na go mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa'i phyir ci'i phyir dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: but if there is no obstruction, why would all things not manifest just as they are, since the inconceivable power of the Buddha has been attained?

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bor yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i ngo bor yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is attained because all things are completely known just as they are, in their conventional and ultimate natures.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa spang bar bya ba la lam 'di kho na dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa spang bar bya ba la lam 'di kho na dam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this path alone is the highest for the elimination of obscurations.

original: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pas stong pa nyid kyi lam 'di kho na thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pas stong pa nyid kyi lam 'di kho na thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis brten par bya'o //
translated: Thus, those who desire to attain the state of omniscience should rely on this path of emptiness alone, with wisdom endowed with skillful means.

original: 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just one or the other.

original: thabs med pa'i shes rab 'ba' zhig gis brten na nyan thos bzhin du 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par lhung la /
analyzed: thabs med pa'i shes rab 'ba' zhig gis brten na nyan thos bzhin du 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par lhung la /
translated: If one relies on just the wisdom without the means, one falls into nirvana, because one actualizes cessation, like the Sravakas.

original: thabs tsam brten pas kyang phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i phyir 'khor bar lhung ngo //
analyzed: thabs tsam brten pas kyang phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i phyir 'khor bar lhung ngo //
translated: If one relies on just the means, one falls into cyclic existence, because one is mistaken.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / thabs kyi stobs kyis mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / thabs kyi stobs kyis mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the power of wisdom, one does not remain in cyclic existence, and because of the power of means, one does not enter nirvana. Thus, the path of the bodhisattvas, which has the nature of means and wisdom, is the cause for attaining the nirvana that is not a location.

original: de skad du 'phags pa ga ya mgo ri las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa ga ya mgo ri las kyang /
translated: Thus, the Arya Gayasirsha-sutra says:

original: @290b lam gang dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mdor bstan pa gnyis po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: @290b lam gang dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mdor bstan pa gnyis po 'di dag ste /
translated: The two brief teachings of the bodhisattva path are those by possessing which bodhisattvas quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: gnyis gang zhen 'di lta ste shes rab dang thabs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis gang zhen 'di lta ste shes rab dang thabs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: What are the two? They are wisdom and method.🔽And in the Noble Teaching of Vimalakirti,

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags par bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags par bstan pa las kyang /
translated: it says,

original: thabs dang bral pa'i shes rab ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bral pa'i shes rab ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'ching ba'o //
translated: “Wisdom without method is a fetter for the bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs kyang 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs kyang 'ching ba'o //
translated: Method without wisdom is also a fetter.

original: shes rab dang bcas pa'i thabs ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang bcas pa'i thabs ni thar pa'o //
translated: Method with wisdom is liberation.

original: thabs dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyang thar pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyang thar pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Wisdom with method is also liberation.”

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po sngon du 'go ba can bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po sngon du 'go ba can bskyed de /
translated: Therefore, you should generate the thought of awakening, which is preceded by great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob par bya ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs te /
translated: In order to attain the state of omniscience, one needs both wisdom and skillful means.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid thams cad la goms par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid thams cad la goms par bya'o //
translated: In order to attain the state of omniscience, one should cultivate all the characteristics of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, such as generosity.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva avoids the extremes of superimposition and denial and enters the middle way.

original: shes rab kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar yang mi lhung la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar yang mi lhung la /
translated: Because of the wisdom that knows the nature of all things just as they are, one does not fall into the extreme of superimposition.

original: thabs bstan pas ni kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams thams cad la skur ba mi 'debs pa'i phyir skur pa'i mthar yang mi lhung ngo /
analyzed: thabs bstan pas ni kun rdzob tu sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams thams cad la skur ba mi 'debs pa'i phyir skur pa'i mthar yang mi lhung ngo /
translated: Because of the teaching of method, one does not fall into the extreme of denial, for one does not deny the conventional existence of all the merits of generosity and so on.

original: lhags pas nyam thag pas me bzhin du phyin ci log gi lcags pa bsal ba'i phyir stong pa nyid brten par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: lhags pas nyam thag pas me bzhin du phyin ci log gi lcags pa bsal ba'i phyir stong pa nyid brten par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: One should rely on emptiness alone in order to dispel the cold of the afflictions and the heat of suffering and in order to dispel the fire of the inverted views.

original: mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But they do not actually do so.

original: ji skad du chos bcu pa'i mdo las /

translated: As the Daśadharmaka Sūtra says,

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like this:

translated: and respect it,🔽esteem it,

original: mgu bar byed mchod par byed /🔽legs par bkur sti byed kyang de 'di snyam du bdag gis me 'di la gus par byas /🔽bla mar byas /🔽mgu bar byas /
analyzed: mgu bar byed mchod par byed / legs par bkur sti byed kyang de 'di snyam du bdag gis me 'di la gus par byas / bla mar byas / mgu bar byas /
translated: make offerings to it,

original: mchod par byas /
analyzed: mchod par byas /
translated: and revere it.

analyzed: bkur sti byas pas lag pa gnyis kyis 'di gzung bar bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: But he would not think, “I will take hold of this fire with both hands.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: de'i gzhi las bdag gi lus kyi sdug bsngal dang / sems kyi yid mi bde bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
translated: He thinks, “It could be the basis for physical pain for me and mental anguish.”

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang mya ngan las 'das pa la sems pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa yin yang /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa mngon @291a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang mya ngan las 'das pa la sems pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa yin yang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon @291a * //
translated: In the same way, although the bodhisattva is intent on nirvāṇa, is devoted to nirvāṇa, is intent on nirvāṇa, and is inclined to nirvāṇa,

original: sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: sum du mi byed do //
translated: he does not actualize nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: bdag 'di'i gzhi las byang chub las ldog par 'gyur du 'ong ngo snyam mo //
translated: He thinks, “May I not turn away from awakening because of this!”

translated: The expansion of means and wisdom

translated: should be ascertained from the Akṣayamatisūtra and so on.

translated: In brief, what is the bodhisattva’s means?

translated: Having realized with wisdom that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic existence, one should rely on the accumulation of merit, such as generosity, by seeing that only emptiness and great compassion exist, just like illusions and so forth.🔽Thus, if one attains all the excellent perfections of the higher realms, such as the Tathagata's great enjoyment, the pure land, retinue, rupakaya, and so forth, one will remain for as long as samsara exists, accomplishing all aspects of benefit and happiness for all beings without exception.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad bsgrub cing gnas pas rtog pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dang ba nye bar bskyed nas /
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad bsgrub cing gnas pas rtog pa dang ldan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dang ba nye bar bskyed nas /
translated: Therefore, the wise should generate faith in the Bhagavan Buddha,

analyzed: de'i yon tan nye bar yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o // de ltar bdag gis dbu ma'i lam //
